revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-09 15:48:29.000000000', 'message': 'Make create_user domain-aware for V3CredsClient

Currently create_user is just inherited from CredsClient and, therefore,
does not pass a domain_id to the /v3/users POST API call to create a new
user. As a result a domain with id "default" is used as no domain is
explicitly passed in the API call which results in 404 NOT FOUND and the
following error: "Could not find domain: default.".

The right way is passing a domain from:

1) CONF.auth.admin_domain_name
2) CONF.auth.default_credentials_domain_name

This is already taken into account when a domain_name is passed from
identity_utils during object instantiation and used for in the
create_project method specific to V3CredsClient. The API calls only
accept a domain_id which is why creds_domain field of a V3CredsClient
object is used to store an id of a domain_name domain passed via
constructor. The same can be used for create_user method specific to v3.

Change-Id: I66f22c61d7a8596cafdc415654edfecdc5495d2e
Closes-Bug: #1613819
'}, {'created': '2019-03-10 23:12:21.000000000', 'message': 'Make create_user domain-aware for V3CredsClient

commit_message:
Make create_user domain-aware for V3CredsClient

Currently create_user is just inherited from CredsClient and, therefore,
does not pass a domain_id to the /v3/users POST API call to create a new
user. As a result a domain with id "default" is used as no domain is
explicitly passed in the API call which results in 404 NOT FOUND and the
following error: "Could not find domain: default.".

The right way is passing a domain from:

1) CONF.auth.admin_domain_name
2) CONF.auth.default_credentials_domain_name

This is already taken into account when a domain_name is passed from
identity_utils during object instantiation and used for in the
create_project method specific to V3CredsClient. The API calls only
accept a domain_id which is why creds_domain field of a V3CredsClient
object is used to store an id of a domain_name domain passed via
constructor. The same can be used for create_user method specific to v3.

Change-Id: I66f22c61d7a8596cafdc415654edfecdc5495d2e
Closes-Bug: #1613819

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-15 13:41:20.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [OVN][QOS] FIP for DVR

TODO: everything, including a LP bug.

Change-Id: Ica5eae22bc989965e8a7e7595bc7be02d9f65640
Closes-Bug: # TBD
'}, {'created': '2021-02-15 17:11:35.000000000', 'message': '[OVN][QOS] QoS for distributed floating IP

When floating IP is distributed in OVN, the NAT is done locally
in the same host as the private IP port (same chassis). The QoS
rule match should have a local chassis port to apply the rule;
in this case, the mentioned private IP port UUID will match the
condition "is_chassis_resident(port_id)".

In the case the floating IP is not distributed, the current behaviour
is valid.

Change-Id: Ica5eae22bc989965e8a7e7595bc7be02d9f65640
Closes-Bug: #1915723
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN][QOS] QoS for distributed floating IP

When floating IP is distributed in OVN, the NAT is done locally
in the same host as the private IP port (same chassis). The QoS
rule match should have a local chassis port to apply the rule;
in this case, the mentioned private IP port UUID will match the
condition "is_chassis_resident(port_id)".

In the case the floating IP is not distributed, the current behaviour
is valid.

Change-Id: Ica5eae22bc989965e8a7e7595bc7be02d9f65640
Closes-Bug: #1915723

commit_message:
Switch to new rolevar for run-temepst role

Tempest replaced the below rolevar for run-tempest role
- tempest_test_blacklist is replaced by tempest_test_exclude_list
- tempest_black_regex is replaced by tempest_exclude_regex

old name are still supported for compatiblity but we recommend
to switch to new one.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774835
Change-Id: Ifa2fd7152d48afb8a6d624477e1f7d49950a2341

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated.
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.
For more info. please refer [1].

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I5403b96d4dd0faac9f1295d57a1680a7d452c7b1

[{'created': '2016-05-25 08:51:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add skip_unless_attr_equal decorator

Added decorator to check if :
- attibute exists
- expected value

This decorator will allow us to skip tests when the attribute
is different

commit_message:
Add skip_unless_attr_equal decorator

Added decorator to check if :
- attibute exists
- expected value

This decorator will allow us to skip tests when the attribute
is different

Example:
cinder client version 1, 2  .
there are tests that run on v2 but not v1.
User will be able to set a query by attibute.

skip_unless_attr_equal(_api_version, "1")

Change-Id: I81f9a658b1625b92e51da73521817dbce06294d7

this makes me sad but i guess until December we should.

if we need to support python 2 for any reason after that we shoudl create a python 2 branch and use that instead for those downstream jobs. i would prefer not to add any new test to the downstream python2 based release either since they orginally were not inteded to be supported so i would prefer to not limit our testing by what they can support. we agreed to support python2 untill osp 10 exited its support in decemebr however so until then we can continue to make py2.7 compatiblity changes like this. that said maybe we would be better to just create the py2 branch now instead? what do people think?'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2021-02-16 14:19:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Use Tempest for dashboard test instead of tempest-horizon

All tests implemented in tempest-horizon have been merged to tempest[1]
and tempest-horizon will be retired, so we assume that we no longer
need to install tempest-horizon plugins.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/771727/

Change-Id: I2639127f9258298f48154f782d654858a71a7c36

commit_message:
Correct HTTP redirect

Each '[^/]+' represents one component in the guide
URLs under the main domain. There are three of them.
For version 'victoria':

docs.openstack.org
   project-deploy-guide (1)
      charm-deployment-guide (2)
         victoria (3)

Change-Id: I9b60afa595af1e475a0db4e3484cb085ee1b30e7

commit_message:
Fix for not passing CA cert to nova-compute

The charm looked for `keystone_juju_ca_cert` on disk
instead of
`/usr/local/share/ca-certificates/keystone_juju_ca_cert.crt`

Synced charm-helpers for
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/570

commit_message:
Add plumbing for testing secure RBAC personas

This commit updates the DDT protection tests with addition cases so that
we can test the new personas we're adding. It renames the existing tests
to use the term 'legacy', in hopes that it's more descriptive of the
fact it's testing old authorization behavior.

This commit also updates the test utility methods to provide
system-specific context objects and wraps the existing dummy_context()
method.

And the changes necessary to make the new personas work.

Change-Id: I8e9365c60fbb608e95d001758cbe02ed1b865f79

subject: CI: fix ceph-ansible installation after cryptography 3.4 release
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-16 12:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-16 17:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-16 18:00:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-16 12:31:29.000000000', 'message': "CI: fix ceph-ansible installation after cryptography 3.4 release

Installing ceph-ansible in the virtualenv on CentOS 8 fails with:

    ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'setuptools_rust'

This error appeared following the release of cryptography 3.4, which now
includes Rust code. It can be installed without Rust using a Python
wheel, but only with more recent pip than version 9.0.3 available as RPM
on CentOS 8. The cryptography bug report [1] recommends pip>=19.1.1.

This change upgrades pip in the virtualenv before installing
ceph-ansible.

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/5753

Change-Id: I47473de6f71c422db2238d653c2d8f379c55e79b
(cherry picked from commit 5fc7707938d1c15506bfdbe02ae5b32ea885d0be)
"}]
commit_message:
CI: fix ceph-ansible installation after cryptography 3.4 release

Installing ceph-ansible in the virtualenv on CentOS 8 fails with:

    ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'setuptools_rust'

This error appeared following the release of cryptography 3.4, which now
includes Rust code. It can be installed without Rust using a Python
wheel, but only with more recent pip than version 9.0.3 available as RPM
on CentOS 8. The cryptography bug report [1] recommends pip>=19.1.1.

This change upgrades pip in the virtualenv before installing
ceph-ansible.

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/5753

Change-Id: I47473de6f71c422db2238d653c2d8f379c55e79b
(cherry picked from commit 5fc7707938d1c15506bfdbe02ae5b32ea885d0be)

commit_message:
Bifrost: pin IPA builder to 2.4.0

Train & earlier

IPA builder master branch now requires diskimage-builder 3.4.0, but
Python 2 is supported only up to DIB 2.38.

This change works around the issue by pinning IPA builder to 2.4.0,
which has a Python 2 compatible dependency on DIB.

Change-Id: I570970c8febe79eb424db376ac65e375fd410c1f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-05 15:11:42.000000000', 'message': "tests: Add functional test for #1898272

If you have two host NUMA nodes and you mark the entirety of one node
for shared vCPUs (VCPU) and the other for dedicated vCPUs (PCPU), then
it should not be possible to boot an instance with a 'mixed' CPU policy
and a single NUMA node, since satisfying that request should necessitate
splitting across host nodes. This is not currently the case. Prove that
out.

Change-Id: I72afe21d117e932cc00c9f616618fb3722bf8ca4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1898272

splitting across host nodes. This is not currently the case. Prove that
out.

Change-Id: I72afe21d117e932cc00c9f616618fb3722bf8ca4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1898272
"}]
commit_message:
functional: Add test for #1898272

If you have two host NUMA nodes and you mark the entirety of one node
for shared vCPUs (VCPU) and the other for dedicated vCPUs (PCPU), then
it should not be possible to boot an instance with a 'mixed' CPU policy
and a single NUMA node, since satisfying that request should necessitate
splitting across host nodes. This is not currently the case. Prove that
out.

Change-Id: I72afe21d117e932cc00c9f616618fb3722bf8ca4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1898272

commit_message:
increase verbose level for release notes build

Raise the verbose level for the release notes build so that sphinx will
show the contents of the RST being produced by reno on the console,
along with line numbers.  This allows someone to correlate the line
numbers in error messages with a release note by looking for the
comments containing reno file names.

Change-Id: I40a1f91f820e72259d2739e53e124f63af74640d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add the ability to offload amphora logs

This patch adds the ability to enable log offloading from the amphora
instances to an Octavia rsyslog container.

commit_message:
Add Octavia use of the rsyslog image

Octavia is adding a container to collect logs from inside the
amphora instances. This patch adds Octavia to the list of services
leveraging the existing rsyslog container.

Change-Id: I3ce6808379790e2e4d96027d5f92384249c8c783
(cherry picked from commit 32c96fe430feddfbf353d076eda36f6cfcdbfd1a)
(cherry picked from commit 284376145b371dfd64243b2a4460fb09c4e6f8aa)
(cherry picked from commit c8b92cb3606e93465fb7f1f0ffff11b73204ed6d)

commit_message:
[Queens only] Fix ownership of octavia_rsyslog log directory

The octavia_rsyslog container should not use the octavia user and group
since the rsyslog image doesn't know about that user. It should use
root and have a dedicated log directory on the host to avoid mixing
ownerships with the octavia containers that are running as octavia user.

Conflicts:
  docker/services/octavia-health-manager.yaml

Change-Id: Ie7eb7905eb33235fc73f94b9e84f553394e951fd
Closes-Bug: #1907260
(cherry picked from commit ffd86b3f2c7352ff530d6f37664aaa76b9a81b1c)

commit_message:
Up pbr requirements - failing openstack-tox

This review ups the pbr requirements in stable/train
to match those in stable/ussuri.

openstack-tox-pep8 tests are failing with errors about
finding a version that satisfies the previous requirement.

Change-Id: I61595eb7cd535ec74af06b668012a3f6f1843876

commit_message:
Check that etc/resolv.conf.ORIG exists before edit

In RHEL 8.4, /etc/resolv.conf is not present by default.
As such, removing the nameservers will fail because
etc/resolv.conf.ORIG never gets created.

This patch makes the nameserver edit only if the
etc/resolv.conf.ORIG file exists.

Change-Id: I2178996d899ffe43e11bfeb512e4fcaa941b8410
(cherry picked from commit 5c4be3e15876f3a1e3fd8a6a4737decf18914161)

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated.
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.
For more info. please refer [1].

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: Id062b4014a61adf75fd9917a6928c0521739fc01

For some reason, after queens to train FFU, when drive pci
whitelist is executed, the hiera output is shown with the
default output format 'ruby' (with => instead of :). This

(cherry picked from commit 8a79c1b635efb545bdd23c2ecc6fbe11c34bd924)

commit_message:
Force json output format for hiera in derive pci whitelist

For some reason, after queens to train FFU, when drive pci
whitelist is executed, the hiera output is shown with the
default output format 'ruby' (with => instead of :). This
results in json parsing error. Force the output to be json
which will work for regular and the ffu cases.

Change-Id: I065ec0e7ae14530f6bf4f6fe356e885ba2b30d7f
(cherry picked from commit 8a79c1b635efb545bdd23c2ecc6fbe11c34bd924)

commit_message:
Improve name of charms deploy guide

For both 'latest' and 'victoria' series:

a) For 'charm-deployment-guide', change value of
   'service' key in the hopes of having the landing
   page display this:

   "OpenStack Charms Deployment Guide"

   as opposed to the current:

   "Deploying OpenStack using Juju Charms Guide"

b) Move sister project 'charm-guide' alongside the
   'charm-deployment-guide'.

Change-Id: I364519f18e95081a4695600c12bc8a781c8457e7

commit_message:
Remove preflight checks

Other tasks in the role will fail with similar errors to these
preflight checks if virtualenv is missing or variables are undefined.

As these tasks are run many times we should drop them and rely
on regular ansible error messages.

Change-Id: Iabec3f88c02bf4d44c09735a314985366daddffb
(cherry picked from commit a4d8d5fa3eb44c7b52bfbfb9d2ea0928ded6e1a1)

messages:
[{'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-09 17:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-09 17:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Need to fix tests'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-10 11:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-02-11 05:44:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-11 09:15:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-11 09:16:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

Thanks Abhishek for the review.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-11 11:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-02-11 14:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

sorry for not highlighting this earlier'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-02-11 14:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-02-11 15:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-02-11 15:16:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

Sorry Rajat,

While I see how this would be convenient to simplify deployment, in Glance service perspective this change does not make sense for few reasons:

1) When glance-api starts it goes through it's store configuration and tests those stores to make sure everything is working as expected for normal operation. This change would remove that check from Cinder store for every startup, not just during the deployment. so this would not be consistent behaviour across the stores.

2) This change would perform the check every time new image is created. Increasing overhead and redundant API calls we've been working to reduce, not increase.

3) Because not executed during config, there is no code or checks in place to handle these exceptions during the store_add(..)  function calls, causing the failure cases dumping.

I think the correct way forward really is to address the issues where it occurs and either have Cinder service as requirement for Glance service when it's configured as store just like we expect Ceph being up and running by the time we start glance with rbd store, or if the dependency chain is not achievable during initial deployment, maybe the solution is to configure the cinder-store after the services has been deployed.

If I'm missing something outside of the new deployment corner case that actually affects the day to day operations in perspective of Glance stability, please let me know and I will reconsider my CR."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-02-11 15:38:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2
> 
> 1) When glance-api starts it goes through it's store configuration and tests those stores to make sure everything is working as expected for normal operation. This change would remove that check from Cinder store for every startup, not just during the deployment. so this would not be consistent behaviour across the stores.

Consistency is a great goal, but can't be blindly enforced at the expense of other potential factors.

> 2) This change would perform the check every time new image is created. Increasing overhead and redundant API calls we've been working to reduce, not increase.

Easily mitigated per previous comments.

> 3) Because not executed during config, there is no code or checks in place to handle these exceptions during the store_add(..)  function calls, causing the failure cases dumping.
> 
> I think the correct way forward really is to address the issues where it occurs and either have Cinder service as requirement for Glance service when it's configured as store just like we expect Ceph being up and running by the time we start glance with rbd store, or if the dependency chain is not achievable during initial deployment, maybe the solution is to configure the cinder-store after the services has been deployed.

The core issue is you're trying to validate a (static) configuration setting in a manner that needs to hit another service's API. Cinder volume types are stored in the database, and therefore cannot be created unless the cinder service is running. You've got a chicken/egg problem if you need the cinder service running in order for the admin to create the volume types, but somehow hold off running the glance service until after the volume types exist."}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-11 16:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-11 17:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

I'm not sure if i can provide any additional value to Alan's replies but here's my try.

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2
> > 
> > 1) When glance-api starts it goes through it's store configuration and tests those stores to make sure everything is working as expected for normal operation. This change would remove that check from Cinder store for every startup, not just during the deployment. so this would not be consistent behaviour across the stores.
> 
> Consistency is a great goal, but can't be blindly enforced at the expense of other potential factors.

I think consistency is important but everything cannot be consistent across backends working with different code and architecture. We also try to enforce consistency across different backends in cinder while maintaining their differences.

> 
> > 2) This change would perform the check every time new image is created. Increasing overhead and redundant API calls we've been working to reduce, not increase.
> 
> Easily mitigated per previous comments.
> 
Fixed in latest PS.

> > 3) Because not executed during config, there is no code or checks in place to handle these exceptions during the store_add(..)  function calls, causing the failure cases dumping.
> > 

This check fails the image creation during initial phase without creating any image or volume so there's no leftover to clean but I'm unsure if dumping refers to some other thing?

> > I think the correct way forward really is to address the issues where it occurs and either have Cinder service as requirement for Glance service when it's configured as store just like we expect Ceph being up and running by the time we start glance with rbd store, or if the dependency chain is not achievable during initial deployment, maybe the solution is to configure the cinder-store after the services has been deployed.
> 
> The core issue is you're trying to validate a (static) configuration setting in a manner that needs to hit another service's API. Cinder volume types are stored in the database, and therefore cannot be created unless the cinder service is running. You've got a chicken/egg problem if you need the cinder service running in order for the admin to create the volume types, but somehow hold off running the glance service until after the volume types exist.

I don't think this comparison is fair in terms of deployment since cinder is a core openstack service and most probably deployed with other openstack services whereas rbd isn't, but please correct me if I'm wrong since i don't have expertise in this area."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-02-11 17:15:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> The core issue is you're trying to validate a (static) configuration setting in a manner that needs to hit another service's API. Cinder volume types are stored in the database, and therefore cannot be created unless the cinder service is running. You've got a chicken/egg problem if you need the cinder service running in order for the admin to create the volume types, but somehow hold off running the glance service until after the volume types exist.

Very much agree here. Requiring cinder to be up and fully configured for glance to start and be useful is a huge problem, IMHO. It's an easy dependency to maintain in a single-shot devstack run, but in a real deployment we have got to be able to handle that better. Validating this when we need it is the right approach."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-02-11 17:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-02-11 20:52:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

My $0.02 without looking at the code too carefully.

1. I wonder whether we should rethink the startup requirement (not just for the cinder store, but others too) because it's not clear what it gets us other than making glance more difficult to deploy.  When we had a single store it may have made sense, but with multistore, I don't know that it's reasonable to require that all configured stores be available and ready when the glance-api starts because we don't know how the deployment tooling is going to handle things.  Additionally, until you actually try to store an image, you don't really know that *any* store is really usable (for example, it might not have enough space to store the first image).

2. Even with the startup check, there's still the possibility that some dope on the cinder side might delete the volume type or rename it or something after glance starts, so the check doesn't really guarantee you much.  I suspect the same is true of most of our other stores, namely that being available at glance-api start doesn't guarantee that you're actually going to be put any data in the store.  And with multistore, the end user has the ability to try again with a different store if their first choice returned an error.

Finally, I agree with Dan that we should just go ahead and try to store the image, log a useful message for the operator if the reason is "volume type doesn't exist", but from the end user perspective treat it the same as if the end user is trying to put image data in a store that's full. (In other words, no need for an initial check about the volume_type.)  The probe to verify that the configured volume_type exists was a nice to have, but if it's misconfigured, the operator will find out soon enough (because we will log a clear message!).  I think operators will probably be willing to trade off flexibility in deployment for this check.  Plus, if the tooling is good, it will make sure that glance is only configured with a volume type name that's the same as a type that it's creating in cinder, and the order in which this happens doesn't really matter.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-02-12 00:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Finally, I agree with Dan that we should just go ahead and try to store the image, log a useful message for the operator if the reason is "volume type doesn't exist", but from the end user perspective treat it the same as if the end user is trying to put image data in a store that's full. (In other words, no need for an initial check about the volume_type.)  The probe to verify that the configured volume_type exists was a nice to have, but if it's misconfigured, the operator will find out soon enough (because we will log a clear message!).  I think operators will probably be willing to trade off flexibility in deployment for this check.  Plus, if the tooling is good, it will make sure that glance is only configured with a volume type name that's the same as a type that it's creating in cinder, and the order in which this happens doesn't really matter.

Yeah, I think this makes the most sense. It's one less API call overall than we have today, it gives us the lazy evaluation we're looking for, and also self-corrects at any point if the volume type appears, disappears, etc.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-12 17:28:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-12 17:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-02-12 17:36:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)

I think this is what we should do. Thanks Rajat!

Erno, this seems like a very nice compromise between your desire to validate at startup, and the others' desire to see us avoid a startup failure and adapt in realtime. Can you comment?"}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-02-12 17:57:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-02-12 17:59:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> My $0.02 without looking at the code too carefully.
> 
> 1. I wonder whether we should rethink the startup requirement (not just for the cinder store, but others too) because it's not clear what it gets us other than making glance more difficult to deploy.  When we had a single store it may have made sense, but with multistore, I don't know that it's reasonable to require that all configured stores be available and ready when the glance-api starts because we don't know how the deployment tooling is going to handle things.  Additionally, until you actually try to store an image, you don't really know that *any* store is really usable (for example, it might not have enough space to store the first image).
> 

But Brian,

We do not require all configured stores to be alive for the service to start, we require a store to be alive. If we can't reach signle store during the startup the startup will fail."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-02-12 18:02:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> (3 comments)
> 
> I think this is what we should do. Thanks Rajat!
> 
> Erno, this seems like a very nice compromise between your desire to validate at startup, and the others' desire to see us avoid a startup failure and adapt in realtime. Can you comment?

Ideed, few questions inline but looks like much less wrecking ball to a bent nail, approach."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-02-12 18:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

> We do not require all configured stores to be alive for the service to start, we require a store to be alive. If we can't reach signle store during the startup the startup will fail.

Why should this be the case? I don't really see what the distinction is between "all" vs "some" other than some sort of attempt to not start glance if users can't upload or download images. I think there's plenty of value to glance being able to answer list/show queries even if it can't accept an image or let you download one, especially in a pre-deployment or upgrade situation.

Nova can and does start and respond to API queries, even if there are no hypervisor nodes available to start instances. It also lets you delete instances even if the hypervisors aren't able to actually delete things right away. I would expect neutron to also be able to answer basic API queries, even if the data plane is down.

As Brian pointed out, we've got a sleep(30) in devstack between cinder and glance, purely because glance has to do this on startup. That's the deployment complication Brian is talking about, and I expect that a similar thing is mirrored in real deployments or papered-over with Restart=always service definitions for glance.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-15 13:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-15 13:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(5 comments)

Thanks Dan and Erno for the review.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-02-15 13:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thank you Rajat, few inline suggestions and question.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-15 14:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-02-15 14:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-02-15 14:15:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Validate volume type during volume create

Currently when configuring multiple cinder stores,
glance validates the volume types configured in glance-api.conf
during service startup.
This check however has a dependency on cinder API service to be
up and running.
During certain deployment scenarios, it is not always mandatory
that cinder is already running when we are starting glance hence
this check will fail the glance service hence the deployment
This patch removes the startup exceptions and instead logs a warning.
Also the check is done during volume create so handling for NotFound
exception from cinder is also handled.

Change-Id: I468523b947ad6fcff4b074d2ed1cb7a9e52b15ca
Closes-Bug: #1915163

commit_message:
Remove overcloud set parameter command

Now that the plan is gone, you can just use an environment
file with the new parameters. This was mostly useful with
tripleo-ui which leveraged the plan.

Change-Id: I998cc9631e15677939e2b8f7a112ccba5606662d

subject: libvirt: Don't drop CPU flags with policy='disable' from guest XML
messages:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-12 18:39:53.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Don't drop CPU flags with policy='disable' from guest XML

Commit eeeca4ceff (Handle disabled CPU features to fix live migration
failures, 2020-10-06) literally drops every CPU flag entry from guest
XML that had policy="disable".  I noticed this while testing this
patch[1] that allows disabling CPU flags, where disabled CPU flags are
altogether dropped from the guest XML record.  We should retain them.

The bug[2] the above-mentioned commit was putting a band-aid to -- which
is to ignore disabled CPU flags when computing a baseline CPU, to allow
live migration on some Intel processors -- would've been addressed by
half of the original patch.  That is, in the class LibvirtConfigCPU(),
we can drop the check from the parse_dom(), but keep it in format_dom().
Effectively, this is a partial revert of the said commit (eeeca4ceff).

Example:  In both the below cases, I'm testing with this patch that
allows disabling CPU flags[1].  Test: In `[libvirt]cpu_model_flags`,
enable "md-clear" and "pcid", but disable "mtrr" and "pdpe1gb".

Result without this patch
-------------------------

  <cpu mode='custom' match='exact' check='full'>
    <model fallback='forbid'>Nehalem-IBRS</model>
    <feature policy='require' name='md-clear'/>
    <feature policy='require' name='pcid'/>
  </cpu>

Only the enabled flags are shown for the guest.

Result with this patch
----------------------

  <cpu mode='custom' match='exact' check='full'>
    <model fallback='forbid'>Nehalem-IBRS</model>
    <feature policy='require' name='md-clear'/>
    <feature policy='require' name='pcid'/>
    <feature policy='disable' name='mtrr'/>
    <feature policy='disable' name='pdpe1gb'/>
  </cpu>

Here we see both enabled _and_ disabled flags in the guest XML, which is
much clearer.  So go with this approach.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/774240/ (libvirt: Allow
    disabling CPU flags via `cpu_model_extra_flags`)
[2] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1898715 -- Live migration fails despite
    matching CPUs

blueprint: allow-disabling-cpu-flags

Change-Id: I47451e2b776eba0b038711f2027d565fc950c841
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Don't drop CPU flags with policy='disable' from guest XML

Commit eeeca4ceff (Handle disabled CPU features to fix live migration
failures, 2020-10-06) literally drops every CPU flag entry from guest
XML that had policy="disable".  I noticed this while testing this
patch[1] that allows disabling CPU flags, where disabled CPU flags are
altogether dropped from the guest XML record.  We should retain them.

The bug[2] the above-mentioned commit was putting a band-aid to -- which
is to ignore disabled CPU flags when computing a baseline CPU, to allow
live migration on some Intel processors -- would've been addressed by
half of the original patch.  That is, in the class LibvirtConfigCPU(),
we can drop the check from the parse_dom(), but keep it in format_dom().
Effectively, this is a partial revert of the said commit (eeeca4ceff).

Example:  In both the below cases, I'm testing with this patch that
allows disabling CPU flags[1].  Test: In `[libvirt]cpu_model_flags`,
enable "md-clear" and "pcid", but disable "mtrr" and "pdpe1gb".

Result without this patch
-------------------------

  <cpu mode='custom' match='exact' check='full'>
    <model fallback='forbid'>Nehalem-IBRS</model>
    <feature policy='require' name='md-clear'/>
    <feature policy='require' name='pcid'/>
  </cpu>

Only the enabled flags are shown for the guest.

Result with this patch
----------------------

  <cpu mode='custom' match='exact' check='full'>
    <model fallback='forbid'>Nehalem-IBRS</model>
    <feature policy='require' name='md-clear'/>
    <feature policy='require' name='pcid'/>
    <feature policy='disable' name='mtrr'/>
    <feature policy='disable' name='pdpe1gb'/>
  </cpu>

Here we see both enabled _and_ disabled flags in the guest XML, which is
much clearer.  So go with this approach.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/774240/ (libvirt: Allow
    disabling CPU flags via `cpu_model_extra_flags`)
[2] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1898715 -- Live migration fails despite
    matching CPUs

blueprint: allow-disabling-cpu-flags

Change-Id: I47451e2b776eba0b038711f2027d565fc950c841
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

Use ceph package mirror during CI jobs

This should prevent CI job failures when there are connectivity
issues to the ceph repo from the test nodes.

commit_message:
Do not apply force flag to git.reset

Return applying force flag to all distros. Instead we don't apply force
flag for `git reset` command at all.

Change-Id: I81556c641f891773474644f842ff3b07493e8715

commit_message:
Trigger deploy guide rebuild on a-r-r update

In deploy guide we rely on latest_tag to provide users with valid git tag
in the guide. However this is broken now, since deploy guide rebuild
is not triggered by jobs.

This change makes use of long ago added project-template that
also triggers build on a-r-r update comparing to it's original [1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/commit/9f64b09a4b9dee2c5adcde696b59c689237c5d7a/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L1628-L1649

Change-Id: I4708b2ad183b4c09582f723d6c114012c8a6ea17

commit_message:

collections.MutableMapping has been deprecated since Python 3.3 and
is removed in Python 3.10. The functionality is identical.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-29 14:11:24.000000000', 'message': 'Release keystoneauth for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to keystoneauth since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I0017e88a9f04362aa53b489826105aff39854dd1
'}]
commit_message:
Release keystoneauth for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to keystoneauth since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I0017e88a9f04362aa53b489826105aff39854dd1

commit_message:
Drop use of deprecated collections classes

These were moved in Python 3.3 and the aliases are going away in 3.10.
Preempt that change.

Change-Id: Id09b52ac5e746d8e4818cb4218422fe36f5e72f4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Constraints support
Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more
complex than services as the libraries themselves are listed
in upper-constraints.txt which leads to errors that you can't
install a specific version and a constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper
script to edit the constraints to remove barbican-tempest-plugin.

Change-Id: Ib70cea3887d8adbd67298138eb18f109605c9275

Handle inject gating repo for baseos_as_undercloud

is not present and hence we need to inject gating
repo in undercloud.qcow2 itself.

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated.
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.
For more info. please refer [1].

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I5403b96d4dd0faac9f1295d57a1680a7d452c7b1

[{'created': '2021-02-15 15:35:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix memcached host address.

Since pymemcache 3.4.0, localhost will first translate to ipv6 ([::1])
if possible instead of ipv4 (127.0.0.1). Since memcached is running in
the ipv4 interface, we need to point tooz to the right endpoint.

Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iddf558cd598e41ffead11e164ce2fb1720d15f34
(cherry picked from commit 86b974b75ca998caea8ca949f01d514a00e2ff96)
(cherry picked from commit 965a4f5086b2fa8a9dd0d80af2be28872db3d44f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix memcached host address.

Since pymemcache 3.4.0, localhost will first translate to ipv6 ([::1])
if possible instead of ipv4 (127.0.0.1). Since memcached is running in
the ipv4 interface, we need to point tooz to the right endpoint.

Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iddf558cd598e41ffead11e164ce2fb1720d15f34
(cherry picked from commit 86b974b75ca998caea8ca949f01d514a00e2ff96)
(cherry picked from commit 965a4f5086b2fa8a9dd0d80af2be28872db3d44f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-11 15:31:03.000000000', 'message': "[k8s-fcos] Fix insecure registry

At present, insecure registry doesn't work as expected when Podman is
used. This patch addresses the issue by fixing the ignition user data so
that Podman is configured correctly. Then it ensures that
--insecure-registry flag is provided to Docker in /etc/sysconfig/docker.

Story: 2008479
Task: 41519

Change-Id: I2e1c86e0c88ab5b59185fd523e9c9696ce0f951e
(cherry picked from commit 7bfd7519af9c95044917ad443ea26708c49c1d13)
"}]
commit_message:
[k8s-fcos] Fix insecure registry

At present, insecure registry doesn't work as expected when Podman is
used. This patch addresses the issue by fixing the ignition user data so
that Podman is configured correctly. Then it ensures that
--insecure-registry flag is provided to Docker in /etc/sysconfig/docker.

Story: 2008479
Task: 41519

Change-Id: I2e1c86e0c88ab5b59185fd523e9c9696ce0f951e
(cherry picked from commit 7bfd7519af9c95044917ad443ea26708c49c1d13)

commit_message:
Remove rootwrap execution (3)

Replace rootwrap execution with privsep context execution.
This series of patches will progressively replace any
rootwrap call.

This patch migrates the execution of "ebtables" command to
privsep.

Story: #2007686
Task: #41558

Change-Id: I05deec2f021e1b146fa3f6f7f9b37084df06d59d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-11 11:55:00.000000000', 'message': "Switch to collections.abc.*

The abstract base classes previously defined in 'collections' were moved
to 'collections.abc' in 3.3. The aliases will be removed in 3.10.
Preempt this change now with a simple find-replace:

  $ ag -l 'collections.($TYPES)' | \
      xargs sed -i 's/\(collections\)\.\($TYPES\)/\1.abc.\2/g'

Where $TYPES is the list of moved ABCs from [1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/collections.abc.html

Credit for this commit message to Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ibeec65a367346e56041d195978ff837c59165505
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to collections.abc.*

The abstract base classes previously defined in 'collections' were moved
to 'collections.abc' in 3.3. The aliases will be removed in 3.10.
Preempt this change now with a simple find-replace:

  $ ag -l 'collections.($TYPES)' | \
      xargs sed -i 's/\(collections\)\.\($TYPES\)/\1.abc.\2/g'

Where $TYPES is the list of moved ABCs from [1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/collections.abc.html

Credit for this commit message to Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ibeec65a367346e56041d195978ff837c59165505

Featureset030 runs with scenario007 multinode scenario
which deploys overcloud on single node by defining

"}]
commit_message:
Add missing overcloud_roles in fs030

Featureset030 runs with scenario007 multinode scenario
which deploys overcloud on single node by defining
all required services in ControllerServices parameter.
To avoid heat resource creation of other roles let's
set overcloud_roles to Controller like other multinode
featuresets.

Related-Bug: #1914396
Change-Id: Id3f4a2c4264a939bb1ba1bc21de7cf5751306090

commit_message:
Switch to stable/21.01 branches for zaza testing

For the stable/21.01 charm, use the stable/21.01 branches for zaza and
zaza-openstack-tests.

Also cherry-picking from master:
- pinning pip < 20.3
- disabling python 3.5

Change-Id: Ic53bb49be2448f076e66e67882b13f403498a95b
Co-authored-by: gnuoy <liam.young@canonical.com>

seems like a good plan to push this forward.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-01-21 13:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-01-21 15:51:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/769920/2 : SUCCESS in 2h 47m 09s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-02-02 16:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-02-02 19:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/769920/3/iscsi : FAILURE in 2h 35m 18s'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-02-04 14:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

is this interconnected with https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/773727 ?'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-10 17:15:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-10 17:20:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

I'm tentative on this. On one hand, the fix makes sense. On the other though, it seems the real issue is the call to os.uname, rather than this. Shouldn't we mock that? That'll probably need more work to address whatever issues that introduces but it should be a better solution?"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-02-10 17:29:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1
> 
> I'm tentative on this. On one hand, the fix makes sense. On the other though, it seems the real issue is the call to os.uname, rather than this. Shouldn't we mock that? That'll probably need more work to address whatever issues that introduces but it should be a better solution?

Yeah I was wondering if anything else would be using os.uname tbh for the kernel version of something weird. This was as far down the stack as I could get where it was reasonable that the caller was looking for the arch."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-02-11 00:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/769920/4/iscsi : FAILURE in 2h 48m 10s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-12 16:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-02-12 19:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/769920/5/iscsi : FAILURE in 2h 40m 40s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-16 11:58:17.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

We're going to poison os.uname() instead"}]

commit_message:
tests: Posion nova.objects.fields.Architecture.from_host

We shouldn't be looking up the architecture of the test node during
tests to ensure tests work across nodes with varying architectures.

Change-Id: I83eecb9ba763157d7b37203cbd49859dbd5db7f8

subject: Release puppet-oslo for stable/train
messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-01-29 16:19:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-02-02 15:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hmmm... I think that metadata should be updated first for this kind of project.

C.f an example https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-oslo/commit/5b8790c7c013d50374d1693be62600f31ca018a6'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-02-02 16:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Hmmm... I think that metadata should be updated first for this kind of project.
> 
> C.f an example https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-oslo/commit/5b8790c7c013d50374d1693be62600f31ca018a6

So this means this needs a patch in puppet-oslo repository (and similarly, every puppet-* release patch needs a patch in the related puppet-* repository).

@zhongshengping: is our assumption correct? and some other question:
- does Puppet OpenStack team want release(s) before Train goes to Extended Maintenance in May?
- if yes, should the (release) patches squashed to a single commit?'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-02-16 11:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No response from team, and this was just proposed as a way to help make sure stable commits were actually being released. So abandoning this patch, but feel free to restore at any point, or propose a new release request, when ready for a stable release.'}]

commit_message:
Ensure that the Trilio charm for rocky onwards is py3

The linked bug indicates that the charm fails to install on Focal which
needs python3.  This fix ensures that the Rocky onwards charm support is
python3.

Change-Id: I54db2f0f2f5b720b9d6e3695f0d84947c667aab5
Closes-Bug: #1914452

[{'created': '2021-02-10 23:17:20.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize the check pipeline runtime

devstack-tempest and devstack-tempest-ipv6 jobs
are base jobs and other Tempest job like tempest-full-py3
or Tempest-ipv6-only are derived from those base job so running

'}]
commit_message:
Optimize the check pipeline runtime

devstack-tempest and devstack-tempest-ipv6 jobs
are base jobs and other Tempest job like tempest-full-py3
or Tempest-ipv6-only are derived from those base job so running
tempest jobs are enough.

We do not need to run base jobs as such.

Change-Id: I2526b3bd5dc0d9a46ed15cefd941a3bbd55e6a49

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-12 09:21:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix monasca-grafana check

- Increment retries: waiting 20 seconds (i.e., 10 retries) seem to
  be not enough for monasca-grafana to start on the first node.
  Increasing to 80 seconds (i.e., 40 retries) fixes the issue.

- Prevent the check from running when kolla_action=config. In that
  case, the command would never succeed as the service is not
  deployed yet (similarly to
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/771237).

Closes-Bug: #1915060
Related-Bug: #1821285
Change-Id: I7b42c51a66caed0eccf118615d841dca97a7af9d
(cherry picked from commit 486de99dc8433ed250f8b18b699c795eaacbf40d)

commit_message:
Fix monasca-grafana check

- Increment retries: waiting 20 seconds (i.e., 10 retries) seem to
  be not enough for monasca-grafana to start on the first node.
  Increasing to 80 seconds (i.e., 40 retries) fixes the issue.

- Prevent the check from running when kolla_action=config. In that
  case, the command would never succeed as the service is not
  deployed yet (similarly to
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/771237).

Closes-Bug: #1915060
Related-Bug: #1821285
Change-Id: I7b42c51a66caed0eccf118615d841dca97a7af9d
(cherry picked from commit 486de99dc8433ed250f8b18b699c795eaacbf40d)

commit_message:
Horizon stable releases (Ussuri, Victoria)

As discussed during the last horizon weekly meeting[1], this patch
cuts a new release for stable ussuri, victoria branches to include
latest bug fix.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2021-02-10.log.html#t2021-02-10T15:39:46

commit_message:
Release puppet-placement for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to puppet-placement since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Id5999ad088150655401fcb83704afc2b8379d30b

commit_message:
Release puppet-sahara for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to puppet-sahara since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>

messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-15 11:44:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-15 14:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-16 10:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-15 11:44:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix installation with pip install --user

If kolla-ansible is installed via pip install --user, currently the
kolla-ansible script is unable to locate the installed playbooks.
This leads to a failure when running commands.

This change fixes the issue by checking for the user's .local directory
as a possible installation path.

This fixes some of the scenario tests which were failing after switching
to a user installation in Ifaf1948ed5d42eebaa62d7bad375bbfc12b134d5.
Most tests did not fail since the kolla-ansible script in the source
checkout was used.

Closes-Bug: #1915527

Change-Id: I5b47a146627d06bb3fe4a747c5f20290c726b0f9
(cherry picked from commit 519ca1c08322d1e670c13e60f31b22230fbdc9d3)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix installation with pip install --user

If kolla-ansible is installed via pip install --user, currently the
kolla-ansible script is unable to locate the installed playbooks.
This leads to a failure when running commands.

This change fixes the issue by checking for the user's .local directory
as a possible installation path.

This fixes some of the scenario tests which were failing after switching
to a user installation in Ifaf1948ed5d42eebaa62d7bad375bbfc12b134d5.
Most tests did not fail since the kolla-ansible script in the source
checkout was used.

Closes-Bug: #1915527

Change-Id: I5b47a146627d06bb3fe4a747c5f20290c726b0f9
(cherry picked from commit 519ca1c08322d1e670c13e60f31b22230fbdc9d3)

commit_message:
Fix installation with pip install --user

If kolla-ansible is installed via pip install --user, currently the
kolla-ansible script is unable to locate the installed playbooks.
This leads to a failure when running commands.

This change fixes the issue by checking for the user's .local directory
as a possible installation path.

This fixes some of the scenario tests which were failing after switching
to a user installation in Ifaf1948ed5d42eebaa62d7bad375bbfc12b134d5.
Most tests did not fail since the kolla-ansible script in the source
checkout was used.

Closes-Bug: #1915527

Change-Id: I5b47a146627d06bb3fe4a747c5f20290c726b0f9
(cherry picked from commit 519ca1c08322d1e670c13e60f31b22230fbdc9d3)

commit_message:
Move designate scenario job to the experimental queue temporary

Let's save some infra resources until for now.
When bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1891309 will be fixed,
and that job will be stable again, we can move it back to the check
queue.

Change-Id: I81d9177dcc5f75d9ec775d2d1b020d48f50ec97d

subject: Do not wait for grafana to start when kolla_action=config
messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-15 16:13:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-16 06:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-02-16 10:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2021-02-15 16:13:00.000000000', 'message': "Do not wait for grafana to start when kolla_action=config

Prior to this change it was not possible to generate the config
before deploying the services as you'd hit:

RUNNING HANDLER [Waiting for grafana to start on first node] *************************
Monday 18 January 2021  15:06:35 +0000 (0:00:00.182)       0:04:39.213 ********
skipping: [sv-h22a8-u19]

(cherry picked from commit 31f97d6ccafd4006d20058e12b415fdc947ee776)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not wait for grafana to start when kolla_action=config

Prior to this change it was not possible to generate the config
before deploying the services as you'd hit:

RUNNING HANDLER [Waiting for grafana to start on first node] *************************
Monday 18 January 2021  15:06:35 +0000 (0:00:00.182)       0:04:39.213 ********
skipping: [sv-h22a8-u19]
skipping: [sv-h22a5-u36]
FAILED - RETRYING: Waiting for grafana to start on first node (10 retries left).

This would never succeed as the service has not yet been deployed.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I9437a049b24e5e613a7e66add481a8983b84867a
(cherry picked from commit 31f97d6ccafd4006d20058e12b415fdc947ee776)

commit_message:
Do not wait for grafana to start when kolla_action=config

Prior to this change it was not possible to generate the config
before deploying the services as you'd hit:

RUNNING HANDLER [Waiting for grafana to start on first node] *************************
Monday 18 January 2021  15:06:35 +0000 (0:00:00.182)       0:04:39.213 ********
skipping: [sv-h22a8-u19]
skipping: [sv-h22a5-u36]
FAILED - RETRYING: Waiting for grafana to start on first node (10 retries left).

This would never succeed as the service has not yet been deployed.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I9437a049b24e5e613a7e66add481a8983b84867a
(cherry picked from commit 31f97d6ccafd4006d20058e12b415fdc947ee776)

commit_message:
Handle network config override

It was earlier possible to override network config
for undercloud with a custom config using
``net_config_override`` in undercloud.conf or with
``UndercloudNetConfigOverride`` parameter. Though it's
now possible to change ``UndercloudNetworkConfigTemplate``
parameter to override the default config, we probably
still need to support``net_config_override`` and
``UndercloudNetConfigOverride`` for backward compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1915585
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/775471
Change-Id: Ied2caf9cd5c1b14d30d0badb4e949f620263c96e

These tasks were still running for centos7 based
build-containers and provider jobs, this patch fixes
the conditions for use_kolla to default to true like
it's other usage as default needs to be assumed same.

injecting additinal use_kolla var in provider jobs.

Change-Id: Iabaf3d0939ccf15694e3774c92883d6a30524b13
"}]
commit_message:
Fix conditions for Executing build-report

These tasks were still running for centos7 based
build-containers and provider jobs, this patch fixes
the conditions for use_kolla to default to true like
it's other usage as default needs to be assumed same.
For provider job decide based on OS version to avoid
injecting additinal use_kolla var in provider jobs.

Change-Id: Iabaf3d0939ccf15694e3774c92883d6a30524b13

instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

commit_message:
Change BaseLoggingTestCase setup for logging

96eae957b06e84dce45159faf1008de9a69a26e0 changed initialization for base
tests but logging configuration gets lost after super().setUp()

Revert this part as it is not needed in the end for tests to pass
properly

Change-Id: I4a8ca76920b0f174b37171c09653b6755a2dda5c
Closes-Bug: #1915272

commit_message:
Do not wait for grafana to start when kolla_action=config

Prior to this change it was not possible to generate the config
before deploying the services as you'd hit:

RUNNING HANDLER [Waiting for grafana to start on first node] *************************
Monday 18 January 2021  15:06:35 +0000 (0:00:00.182)       0:04:39.213 ********
skipping: [sv-h22a8-u19]
skipping: [sv-h22a5-u36]
FAILED - RETRYING: Waiting for grafana to start on first node (10 retries left).

This would never succeed as the service has not yet been deployed.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I9437a049b24e5e613a7e66add481a8983b84867a
(cherry picked from commit 31f97d6ccafd4006d20058e12b415fdc947ee776)

commit_message:
Pin Tempest to 26.0.0 for stable stein testing

Stable stein is in Extended maintenance state[1] and
As per Tempest stable branmch testing policy, it stopped
the support for stable/stein in master version. Tempest 26.0.0
tag is last supported tag for stein.

Use that tag to test stable/stein branch before any incompatible
change merge in Tempest master.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/

Change-Id: I715638f11d622de12439cb97a4be999cfab40367

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-12 22:17:36.000000000', 'message': 'More handling of unavailable MySQL

When MySQL is going through a topology change (scale in/out, restarts,
power event) vault may go into error state in the update-status hook.
Add the requests.exceptions.ReadTimeout as one of the edge cases and go
into a blocked state.

Change-Id: Ib668afcb7bf99730a6b1a1a1558a463947dbbe72
Closes-Bug: #1886083
'}]
commit_message:
More handling of unavailable MySQL

When MySQL is going through a topology change (scale in/out, restarts,
power event) vault may go into error state in the update-status hook.
Add the requests.exceptions.ReadTimeout as one of the edge cases and go
into a blocked state.

Change-Id: Ib668afcb7bf99730a6b1a1a1558a463947dbbe72
Closes-Bug: #1886083

commit_message:
[stable] Drop lower-constraints job

As discussed in neutron team meeting [1], it is not worth fixing issues
identified by new pip resolver in stable branches. So let's drop the job

For victoria branch only, bump pylint to fix pip resolver issue

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html#l-164

Change-Id: Ic62b63fd2e1f314f6c465a259df75d197180e1f9

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I5b00ee328f83cec8375ad1538be3a16059af08a3
Closes-Bug: #1863021
(cherry picked from commit 0b78dad62e72caa4d348cb3087f97f138f26a0cf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-30 03:48:31.000000000', 'message': 'Introducing the overcloud-service-status role

This role will hit the overcloud API for nova and cinder, retrieve the services
and will trig a failure if one of these services are either down or deprecated.
The original intent was to validate that nova-consoleauth was deleted after an
update to RHOSP16.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1921115
Change-Id: I057349fdac90a093c67aeb0b2f0a825c4c915e0b

commit_message:
Introducing the overcloud-service-status role

This role will hit the overcloud API for nova and cinder, retrieve the
services and will trig a failure if one of these services are either
down or deprecated. The original intent was to validate that
nova-consoleauth was deleted after an update to RHOSP16.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1921115
Change-Id: I057349fdac90a093c67aeb0b2f0a825c4c915e0b

commit_message:
Release designate for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to designate since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I89c8aec4fd5b9eb299080b83baa04d36187e0b96

[stable] Drop lower-constraints job

identified by new pip resolver in stable branches. So let's drop the job

	lower-constraints.txt

commit_message:
[stable] Drop lower-constraints job

As discussed in neutron team meeting [1], it is not worth fixing issues
identified by new pip resolver in stable branches. So let's drop the job

For ussuri, add isort to test-requirements from original fix attempt [2]

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html#l-164
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-sfc/+/748135
Conflicts:
	lower-constraints.txt
	zuul.d/project.yaml

Change-Id: Ic62b63fd2e1f314f6c465a259df75d197180e1f9
(cherry picked from commit 1a51c0f52e4fa8275333904d617f3b24a7458f4f)

messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2021-02-14 17:49:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2021-02-14 17:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Exploring another option.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2021-02-15 15:51:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow

It is currently impossible to merge anything into this repository because the lower-constraints job times out. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/reno/+/775524 attempted to update the lower constraints list so the job would pass, and it does work but maintaining the list if any dependencies change will take even more time than before because the new pip constraints resolver becomes pathologically slow when asked to constrain only some of the dependencies. After running for 24 hours, it was unable to build a virtualenv using the partial lower-constraints.txt to allow any updates.

We do not encourage anyone to use reno with old dependencies, so I recommend that we drop the lower-constraints job entirely so we can accept fixes such as https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/reno/+/774867'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-15 15:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2021-02-15 17:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-02-16 09:26:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-02-16 10:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}]

The new pip resolver is extremely slow at calculating the
lower-constraints. Some other OpenStack projects have already dropped
the job. Let's do the same for reno.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Change-Id: I489cbdf603991888c13b7730cfeb590fea175c25
"}]
commit_message:
drop lower-constraints

The new pip resolver is extremely slow at calculating the
lower-constraints. Some other OpenStack projects have already dropped
the job. Let's do the same for reno.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Change-Id: I489cbdf603991888c13b7730cfeb590fea175c25

subject: Avoid a full install in tox environments that do not need it
messages: [{'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-02-15 20:35:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-02-16 09:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-15 20:35:58.000000000', 'message': "Avoid a full install in tox environments that do not need it

Usage of usedevelop=True results in all requirements.txt dependencies
always installed (without constraints) even when requirements.txt
is not explicitly added. Override usedevelop for these environments.

Add requirements.txt to the 'docs' environment since it imports
the whole ironic in the process.

Create a separate doc/requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I352f21772ccd68b35806f46851f254edb7c24c60
(cherry picked from commit 8d52a7789ac9eba2b5f8fa34e10922cd917f8e36)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid a full install in tox environments that do not need it

Usage of usedevelop=True results in all requirements.txt dependencies
always installed (without constraints) even when requirements.txt
is not explicitly added. Override usedevelop for these environments.

Add requirements.txt to the 'docs' environment since it imports
the whole ironic in the process.

Create a separate doc/requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I352f21772ccd68b35806f46851f254edb7c24c60
(cherry picked from commit 8d52a7789ac9eba2b5f8fa34e10922cd917f8e36)

commit_message:
Fix docs

We are using sphinx latest verion (3.5.0), this causes
`Extension error (sphinx.ext.viewcode)` [1].
The problem was found in [2]
Adding ussuri requirements to docs env will avoid the problem.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/8880
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic-inspector/+/775640

commit_message:
Release ironic for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to ironic since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Ib3ac8ff86214b0362b117b136a616c83cd1eec4d

of defaulting to the role's playbook.

[{'created': '2021-02-13 12:05:27.000000000', 'message': "Add ContainerDefaultPidsLimit to set default pid limits in containers.conf

Starting With podman 2.X the default pids-limits has been halved from
4096 to 2048 (see the dep-on change Id5d5fb9d20c0295763c78171190b9eda13508617 for
more details).

Let's add a parameter to override this value so an operator can raise
this limit globally.

Depends-On: Id5d5fb9d20c0295763c78171190b9eda13508617
Change-Id: I38a72609e6495b979861105f321b5730669a6a2b
(cherry picked from commit 781beb757121c3b3e535af6d2240163e58a33ddd)
(cherry picked from commit 3ac51218f730685016fc7f4d92d90481600d3396)
"}]
commit_message:
Add ContainerDefaultPidsLimit to set default pid limits in containers.conf

Starting With podman 2.X the default pids-limits has been halved from
4096 to 2048 (see the dep-on change Id5d5fb9d20c0295763c78171190b9eda13508617 for
more details).

Let's add a parameter to override this value so an operator can raise
this limit globally.

Depends-On: Id5d5fb9d20c0295763c78171190b9eda13508617
Change-Id: I38a72609e6495b979861105f321b5730669a6a2b
(cherry picked from commit 781beb757121c3b3e535af6d2240163e58a33ddd)
(cherry picked from commit 3ac51218f730685016fc7f4d92d90481600d3396)

(1 comment)

Well, the version bumps almost looks OK, except the one that me and Hervé commented at.
For me it's strange, that major versions were not bumped with the new branch. Isn't that a requirement?"}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-02-12 20:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

> Well, the version bumps almost looks OK, except the one that me and Hervé commented at.
> For me it's strange, that major versions were not bumped with the new branch. Isn't that a requirement?

Ignore my above question, these are in cycle-with-intermediary release model, which do not require major version bump for new release series [1] ("we increment at least the minor number (the Y in X.Y.Z) for the first release in the next development cycle"). So this patch looks OK to me.

Adding only +2 now. I'll let @Hervé, to approve this on Monday.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/release-management.html#services-horizon-plugins-and-other-deliverables'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-02-16 08:47:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
New bugfix and feature releases for oslo.

A new releases for oslo for victoria and wallaby.

Change-Id: Ibd5130f49df68e87bc390c68fbdce6341c39c6e5

- cannot install the best candidate for the job

'}, {'created': '2019-11-20 22:40:07.000000000', 'message': "[dnm] testing centos-8 bringup

Random thoughts

[{'created': '2021-02-16 05:46:22.000000000', 'message': 'Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

For more info. please refer [1].

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I4e0c00b6d01470f59a6fa5799eaa10d3e5e94f61

in zaqar_ui/api/rest/zaqar.py file to fix pep8 issue.

Change-Id: I4e0c00b6d01470f59a6fa5799eaa10d3e5e94f61

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated.
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.
For more info. please refer [1]. It also import ugettext_lazy
in zaqar_ui/api/rest/zaqar.py file to fix pep8 issue.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I4e0c00b6d01470f59a6fa5799eaa10d3e5e94f61

commit_message:
Add TLS options to oslo.cache

This patch specifies a set of options required to build a TLS context.
The context built from those options can later on be passed to any of
the oslo.cache backends that supports TLS connections.

Original oslo.cache change:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.cache/+/725405

Change-Id: I415cfee6045cd904e9675b97750c5de2f1be55d3
(cherry picked from commit 5a8dc2b7525d58f241cbeea1ae1631d22ce87481)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-05 14:12:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add authtoken security options

Add ability to specify the memcache_security_strategy and
memcache_secret_key for keystone authtoken middleware.
The keys for individual services are hashed with a salt,
to isolate them.

commit_message:
Add authtoken security options

Add ability to specify the memcache_security_strategy and
memcache_secret_key for keystone authtoken middleware.
The keys for individual services are hashed with a salt,
to isolate them.

Change-Id: I8d558cac3c23c3c0708e7e00d7bb83ac91795bb7

messages: [{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-02-13 06:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-02-15 18:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-02-15 22:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-13 06:14:34.000000000', 'message': "Always set NetworkDeploymentActions to its default

There are instances users use ``NetworkDeploymentActions`` to
do network configuration during update, but just drop the
parameter for subsequent updates. This sometimes results in
network configuration changes in existing nodes and disruptions.
Let's always set them to defaults unless overridden explicitly.

Change-Id: Ibe7925e4ee568d3d45e138d543b6d7064a8503a3
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1928055
"}]
commit_message:
Always set NetworkDeploymentActions to its default

There are instances users use ``NetworkDeploymentActions`` to
do network configuration during update, but just drop the
parameter for subsequent updates. This sometimes results in
network configuration changes in existing nodes and disruptions.
Let's always set them to defaults unless overridden explicitly.

Change-Id: Ibe7925e4ee568d3d45e138d543b6d7064a8503a3
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1928055

commit_message:
Force json output format for hiera in derive pci whitelist

For some reason, after queens to train FFU, when drive pci
whitelist is executed, the hiera output is shown with the
default output format 'ruby' (with => instead of :). This
results in json parsing error. Force the output to be json
which will work for regular and the ffu cases.

Change-Id: I065ec0e7ae14530f6bf4f6fe356e885ba2b30d7f
(cherry picked from commit 8a79c1b635efb545bdd23c2ecc6fbe11c34bd924)

[{'created': '2021-01-19 07:33:29.000000000', 'message': 'nova: Use LIBGUESTFS_BACKEND=direct

After change [1] nova-compute launch libguestfs using the default
``qemu:///system``, but when ``inject_password` is set to true and
user tries to create vm, the vm creation is successful and we could
see libguestfs error in nova-compute logs.

This change forces libvirt to use ``direct`` when launching instances
on host.

[1] Ib55936ea562dfa965be0764647e2b8e3fa309fd6

commit_message:
nova: Use LIBGUESTFS_BACKEND=direct

After change [1] nova-compute launch libguestfs using the default
``qemu:///system``, but when ``inject_password` is set to true and
user tries to create vm, the vm creation is successful and we could
see libguestfs error in nova-compute logs.

This change forces libvirt to use ``direct`` when launching instances
on host.

[1] Ib55936ea562dfa965be0764647e2b8e3fa309fd6

Change-Id: I195358742c19d6ea0a3d32979896c0268e3b55a6
Closes-bug: #1912141
(cherry picked from commit 67917bf65076ce8a0aeb568e48d28dd1bd1f2995)
(cherry picked from commit 6a37431cedc7efc79e214f66cd3c845bde8bd58e)
(cherry picked from commit 1484c4560740d68d79008bbc211811e13e5b52b6)
(cherry picked from commit e26e6a1fb472ba8bf5a27d30290f011f05a70d2b)

commit_message:
Remove DefaultPasswords interface

This was mainly there as an legacy interface which was
for internal use. Now that we pull the passwords from
the existing environment and don't use it, we can drop
this.

Reduces a number of heat resources.

Change-Id: If83d0f3d72a229d737a45b2fd37507dc11a04649

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-02 10:08:18.000000000', 'message': "ironic: stop defaulting to iscsi deploy in preparation for its deprecation

We have announced our plans to deprecate and eventually remove the iscsi
deploy interface [1]. To prepare for that, the iscsi deploy is no longer
enabled by default. The default value of IronicImageDownloadSource is changed
to 'http' to reduce the upgrade impact for clouds without swift (ironic
upstream is planning to make a similar change). Underclouds still use swift
for now to save disk space.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-September/016952.html

Change-Id: I1de6853eebc545d65ef6ce09276be3bbac2132bd
