subject: Install xinetd clustercheck after mariadb is installed and setup
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-02-12 13:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-02-12 17:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-02-15 08:35:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-12 13:24:20.000000000', 'message': 'Install xinetd clustercheck after mariadb is installed and setup

The configuration of mariadb is done mostly in handlers and previously
the code would install the xinetd clustercheck script before calling
flush_handlers to bootstrap and initialise the database. This leads
to a situation where the clustercheck may be attempting to interact
with the database during bootstrapping and before the monitoring user
has been created.

This change moves the setup tasks for the clustercheck service until
after the database has been bootstrapped and the users created. This
means that any healthchecks from the loadbalancer will not be seen by
the database until after the setup is completed during the initial
deployment.

Change-Id: Ibd55306a5c17bc0a4333e43725f1637420a2c9d9
(cherry picked from commit 3d07a246d5d9300d2ee3e8befbebba454dc4bcf8)
'}]
commit_message:
Install xinetd clustercheck after mariadb is installed and setup

The configuration of mariadb is done mostly in handlers and previously
the code would install the xinetd clustercheck script before calling
flush_handlers to bootstrap and initialise the database. This leads
to a situation where the clustercheck may be attempting to interact
with the database during bootstrapping and before the monitoring user
has been created.

This change moves the setup tasks for the clustercheck service until
after the database has been bootstrapped and the users created. This
means that any healthchecks from the loadbalancer will not be seen by
the database until after the setup is completed during the initial
deployment.

Change-Id: Ibd55306a5c17bc0a4333e43725f1637420a2c9d9
(cherry picked from commit 3d07a246d5d9300d2ee3e8befbebba454dc4bcf8)

commit_message:
Factor out unnecessary set_fact

These varaibles are not required to be persisted as facts, so
convert them from facts to task vars to save a task execution.

Change-Id: Ibaae18199295761f8b52da31cccb9fa8ec40558b

[{'created': '2021-02-12 15:48:20.000000000', 'message': "OpenShift: Add configured subnets to the detected

Turns out there's an OpenShift mode where it's required to actually
hardcode a worker_nodes_subnet as some nodes does not have the Machine
objects. This commit solves that by making sure that
[pod_vif_nested]worker_nodes_subnets are also added to whatever the
OpenShiftNodesSubnets driver detects.

Change-Id: I7e08062473efeaba67a38ab0b2451626df77def8
"}]
commit_message:
OpenShift: Add configured subnets to the detected

Turns out there's an OpenShift mode where it's required to actually
hardcode a worker_nodes_subnet as some nodes does not have the Machine
objects. This commit solves that by making sure that
[pod_vif_nested]worker_nodes_subnets are also added to whatever the
OpenShiftNodesSubnets driver detects.

Change-Id: I7e08062473efeaba67a38ab0b2451626df77def8

commit_message:
Fix deepcopy of the OwnerCheck objects under uwsgi

Patch [1] workarounded problem with deepcopy of the FieldCheck objects
when running with Python 3.6 or older.
But it seems that we have yet another problem with oslo_policy 3.6.2.
This time it is issue with doing deepcopy of the instances of OwnerCheck
class when Neutron runs under mod_uwsgi.
This patch fixes/workarounds that by adding same implementation of the
__deepcopy__ method to the OwnerCheck class as [1] added to FieldCheck.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/774621

Closes-Bug: #1915494
Change-Id: Idf1dcdeaa94ae76cf057c4c04982dc1ee0478f86

commit_message:
Add cache-control=no-cache header to CORS test requests

Also match expected Etag header to quoted or unquoted values
to tolerate etag-quoter middleware being present or not.

Change-Id: Ie8b923e7be71509e96b80a3873c52609030c73b7

commit_message:
Add NetworkSecGroupTest in skiplist

In patch[1] we added NetworkSecGroupTest in skiplist for victoria only
but we are randonmly hitting bug[2] for multiple release including
master, victoria and ussuri. (This test is not running on train)

Adding NetworkSecGroupTest in skiplist for master and ussuri branch as
well till we troubleshoot the issue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-tempest-skiplist/+/768152
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1908982
Related-Bug: #1908982

Change-Id: I46eed8e0e1639f75b642ce76e45dd7a6af82065a

commit_message:
Give probe tests a second chance to pass

...and bump up their timeout, since that seems more likely to happen if
we have to retry.

Change-Id: Ie05521f6cd146234dc5615c96ad19681b43e9110
(cherry picked from commit d4c0a7d3b3106f8b491e78ea21fca36c99ad04d9)

commit_message:
Make possible to avoid aide installation

This patch adds variable `security_rhel7_enable_aide`. When it's False,
all AIDE related tasks would be ommited.

Change-Id: I64af348d9f49922ab51d8cd348d987df4263faa1
(cherry picked from commit 180fc448eb0dd485297da2d3b3fae48abb9d3599)

Remove samples from the hardware test module

They take a lot of space and tehy're mainly static data.
Move them to a separate module that can also be shared with other tests.

commit_message:
Address some rbac review feedback in merged patches

Some of the early test changes for the RBAC work have merged
which is awesome, but a couple minor follow-up items should be
addressed. They are so minor it doesn't really make sense to merge
in with one of the patches in the chain.

Change-Id: I85de4d953237f240c3c220f6a57169c633fb295f

commit_message:
Fix test_security_group_rules testcases

Changing testcases style to tempest classes , removing testcase setup
The expected results is changed between tests , moved the expected
to be local for each testcase.

Change-Id: I7501fec6bfce20f2c67d594119f733fa61501a66

commit_message:
Enable support for cinder multi-backend in tempest

Tempest supports cinder multi-backend tests , by default the devstack installs
a single cinder backend .

Adding two LVM type cinder backends for gate tests:
CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS=lvm:lvm_1,lvm:lvm_2

commit_message:
test_volume_snapshot - move delete snapshot from function

Current code for delete_snapshot is defined inside the testcase .
Moved the delete_snapshot from function .
Other testcase may use it in the future.

Change-Id: If00048edf70fcbac60a57ecf73fdc5fba1c5b16e

Regarding https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1517367 raised about this test.

Which line is the one that fails?  Is it when trying to boot the VM?

From the compute log, there is a failure to boot the VM as it is expecting to boot as HVM, however an HVM image was not supplied.  How is the image actually created?  It seems to be filled with random bytes (so I think I'm missing something because how does libvirt successfully boot)"}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2015-11-19 15:43:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

It's unsafe to use a random disk; this test needs to copy an existing image to a new user-created image (with associated flags) and use that for testing.
Otherwise changes in behaviour in libvirt (for example, checking for a boot sector on the disk) would cause this test to fail."}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2015-11-19 15:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Can you work to merge this file with your patch maybe ?'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-01-11 18:54:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Hi Jordan , thanks for your review .
In this test i adding nova boot to verify that it really works after reactivate . i can merge it to a single file .
the reason i am copying a real image because it does not work on citrix , i can not boot a instance a dummy file .

see comment:
Bob Ball
Nov 19 5:43 PM
↩
Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
It's unsafe to use a random disk; this test needs to copy an existing image to a new user-created image (with associated flags) and use that for testing.
Otherwise changes in behaviour in libvirt (for example, checking for a boot sector on the disk) would cause this test to fail.

I am not sure what does it mean , i have a problem to boot image with citrix ....

Benny"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-01-11 19:30:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-01-13 10:05:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hi Bob , 
Can you share with us a supported cirros for your hardware ? 
I tried to download cirros.img but failed too .

Can you explain how / where to download prepared image for your hardware ?
How to create a glance image ? disk format  ? Container Format ? 

Thanks a lot , 
Benny'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2016-01-13 11:55:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I expect the same issue will affect other hypervisors, but see the following example for where an image is downloaded from:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/stackrc#n586

Then the image gets imported using:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/functions#n40

Specifically, for XenServer, this is at:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/functions#n190

In general, I suggest that if you want to create a new image then we should be downloading an existing image and creating a new one based on that (including it's metadata of course)"}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2016-01-13 11:56:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I mean downloading an existing image __from glance__ then uploading a new one with the same metadata retrieved from glance.  Tempest shouldn't be downloading this from a URL IMO, that's already been set up by devstack or the cloud administrator."}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-01-13 12:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Thanks Bob , 
To be on the safe side  , 
So we can create an image locally a dummy one , upload to glance.
Download the image and upload to glance again with updated meta-data? 

Not sure i understand the steps ,'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2016-01-13 12:15:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Tempest's config includes CONF.compute.image_ref which is a reference to a Glance image.
My suggestion is that, since the test appears to rely heavily on having a _new_ image created, that you download CONF.compute.image_ref from glance, and re-upload it as a non-admin tenant using the metadata taken from glance.  That way it will always replicate the image which is used by the rest of tempest and is known to work in other tests."}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2016-02-29 10:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Removed the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Jordan Pittier <jordan.pittier@scality.com>
'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-07-07 04:29:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-07-07 05:07:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified-1

commit_message:
Boot an instance after image reactive

Testcase steps
- non-admin user creates an image and upload to glance
- admin user deactive the image
- trying to boot an instance from deactivated image
- reactive an image and verify its active
- boot an instance from active image

Change-Id: Iee8448927601a3e93706c7528e08a08a675e8fb9

Hi , 
I think that you are right , i hear from folks complains about tempest comments , specialy from new coders .
I really dont mind to skip this patch , but i do think that we must work and improve testing comments .

As you decide , since its very minor change it wont cause any damage 
if you think its not needed at all i can ababnd this patch.

Thanks
Benny'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2016-08-05 09:41:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

@Benny: Thanks for your reply!
Yeah, I agree with that we can/should improve the comments. So, first, I just wanted to know the reason that you added 'volume' only there.
Second, is that really useful for newcomers? Because the module name is 'test_volumes_backups', so I feel adding 'volume' is redundant.

But anyway, I just removed my -1 because this is a trivial change and Jordan already approved before (I didn't realized that :-P)."}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-08-05 10:55:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Add cinder v3 EncryptionTypes client to tempest lib

Create a library for EncryptionTypesClient
Add a unit-test for EncryptionTypesClient

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-07-21 04:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi , Thanks for your comment , 
We already found issues with backup encrypted volumes :
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1567263

I think it will be better to keep testing encrypted volumes , and use the snapshot from encrypted volume for new volumes ... and more .

Once this patch will be merged , i will add more tests .

I would appreciate your approval.
Benny'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2016-07-21 06:16:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Benny Kopilov wrote:

> Hi , Thanks for your comment ,  We already found issues with backup
> encrypted volumes : https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1567263
>
> I think it will be better to keep testing encrypted volumes , and
> use the snapshot from encrypted volume for new volumes ... and more
> .
>
> Once this patch will be merged , i will add more tests .
>
> I would appreciate your approval. Benny

Thanks for your reply! :)
hmm, I have 3 comments.

1. As you said, this is related to #1567263 bug, so it's good to add
 Related-Bug: #1567263
in the commit message.

2. Can we test this in cinder side? Or if this operation is kind of complicated or likely common things, it might be in scenario.
3. What is the relation between the bug #1567263 and this patch? The bug is not fixed yet, but this test is passed. (I was thinking this patch confirm the bug.) I don't understand the relation between the bug and this patch.. (no relations?)"}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-07-21 06:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi , 
The bug is not related to this test , i just sent you an example of failure with encrypted volume .  i just wanted to show that if it looks similar it does not mean its the same and we will need to cover.
Trying to show that there are tests that may be ok in clear volume and may fail in encrypted .... 


Benny'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2016-07-21 07:13:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Benny Kopilov wrote:

> Hi ,  The bug is not related to this test , i just sent you an
> example of failure with encrypted volume .  i just wanted to show
> that if it looks similar it does not mean its the same and we will
> need to cover. Trying to show that there are tests that may be ok in
> clear volume and may fail in encrypted ....
>
> Benny

Hi Benny, thank for your reply!

OK, I see. I understood that this patch is not related to the bug.
So now, my questions are

1. I think this patch tests some combinations of apis. And individual apis are already tested in the current tempest. Is this correnct?
2. If so, this isn't a simple api test but it might be good to test as a scenario test. What do you think?
3. Can we test this in Cinder side? Why do we need to add this in Tempest? I think it's good to add the reason of it in the commit message."}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-07-21 07:29:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi , 

see inline, 

1. I think this patch tests some combinations of apis. And individual apis are already tested in the current tempest. Is this correnct?
[benny]  I did not find a test in api that do these actions , upload encrypted volume and create snapshot from encrypted volume .
from my point of view its not the same as clear volume and should be covered.


2. If so, this isn't a simple api test but it might be good to test as a scenario test. What do you think?
[benny]  Scenario will be good too but it will require more steps and actions
No objection from my side.
I always a good idea to add more scenario to tempest and i will do it too .
Basically i can create a scenario but its on a seperate patch.

3. Can we test this in Cinder side? Why do we need to add this in Tempest? I think it's good to add the reason of it in the commit message.
[benny] Our automation coverage based on tempest code , we are testing our deployment cloud for many features .
I have never contribute tests to cinder , we need a good sanity and regression tool , sceanrios are really good tests for us , i dont think we may have them in cinder ?

Benny"}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2016-07-21 08:09:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Hi ,
 > 
 > see inline,
 > 
 > 1. I think this patch tests some combinations of apis. And
 > individual apis are already tested in the current tempest. Is this
 > correnct?
 > [benny]  I did not find a test in api that do these actions ,
 > upload encrypted volume and create snapshot from encrypted volume .
 > from my point of view its not the same as clear volume and should
 > be covered.

At the api level, I think it's really same as the current api test code like this.
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_actions.py#L125-L142
So, I think you should add the reason why we should have this similar test as a different test.

 > 
 > 
 > 2. If so, this isn't a simple api test but it might be good to test
 > as a scenario test. What do you think?
 > [benny]  Scenario will be good too but it will require more steps
 > and actions
 > No objection from my side.
 > I always a good idea to add more scenario to tempest and i will do
 > it too .
 > Basically i can create a scenario but its on a seperate patch.

OK. 

 > 
 > 3. Can we test this in Cinder side? Why do we need to add this in
 > Tempest? I think it's good to add the reason of it in the commit
 > message.
 > [benny] Our automation coverage based on tempest code , we are
 > testing our deployment cloud for many features .
 > I have never contribute tests to cinder , we need a good sanity and
 > regression tool , sceanrios are really good tests for us , i dont
 > think we may have them in cinder ?

I don't know your 'automation coverage' system. But anyway, 
I think this commit message should have more details like we can only catch the bug in the integration testing because ....
The example bug which you showed me might be a good example.

And my concern is that volume testings tend to consume much resource in the gate. So, I think about this carefully."}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-07-21 08:19:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi ,
In the test you sent , the volume is created as :
cls.volume = cls.create_volume()

In my code :

cls.volume_type = cls.create_volume_type(name=name)
        # Create an encrypted type
        cls.encryption_type = \
            cls.admin_volume_types_client.create_encryption_type(
                cls.volume_type['id'], provider=provider,
                control_location=control_location)['encryption']
        # Create an encrypted shared volume
        cls.encrypted_volume = cls.create_volume(name=volume_name,
                                                 size=CONF.volume.volume_size,
                                                 display_name=volume_name,
                                                 volume_type=cls.volume_type[
                                                     'name'])"}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2016-07-21 08:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Volume encrypted actions

Added to config.py encrypted volumes params.
Updated testcases to read from tempest.conf

Added testcases for volume encryptions
- test_volume_encrypted_upload
- test_volume_encrypted_snapshots

As I said before, we are requiring negative tests based on API-WG guideline. and this case is not covered on the guideline.

In addition, the spec you specified says the deleted row(in this case, image) is automatically removed from the DB after days. So this test is not the purpose of the spec from my viewpoint. If wanting to verify the spec behavior, we need to spend some days to verify we can create a new image with the deleted image-id.'}, {'account_id': 11075, 'date': '2016-11-22 13:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

There is a bug to allow purge in 0 time .
https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1643287

Benny'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-08 12:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Glance / Negative - create an image with deleted image id

The testcase create an image , after deletion try to create an
image with same image-id that was deleted.

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-01-21 14:34:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I don't think this is going to work for all volume types.

Today, RBD volumes encrypted by c-vol will pass this test but any block based volumes encrypted by n-cpu will fail as the disk size exposed to the instance will be smaller due to the LUKS header overhead.

I honestly think that c-vol needs to recalculate the size of the volume it's providing to qemu-img to take the headers into account ensuring it remains <= the volume size. At that point a test like this doesn't make much sense tbh."}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2021-02-15 07:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Liron Kuchlani.'}]

commit_message:
Add testcases to verify disk size after snapshot created

 - testcase for clear volume
 - testcase for encrypted volume

The testcase run and create a volume from snapshot, attach it to instance
When the volume attached we check with lsblk the volume size.

There is a bug that we manage to reproduce for encrypted volume:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1852168

Change-Id: I02bc587601976f5972b2926d94ce5133b3590a52

commit_message:
Fixes issue of redfish firmware update

Currently ilo5 based hardware does not support redfish
based firmware update. This patch fixes the issue by
making the change to to check whether sushy_task.messages
is present. It was also not calling prepare_ramdisk()
before rebooting the system to update the firmware which
has been fixed in this patch.

Change-Id: I9d70fed0de1829973748c06a1342d7a7af0f93d4
Story: #2008403
Task: #41339
(cherry picked from commit 2e6777d757031a5ea0e52ff0e49a6ca1f3b84316)

subject: Use kube_master_ip for monitoring when no floating ip is used
messages: [{'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-02-10 13:52:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2021-02-10 13:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23084, 'date': '2021-02-10 14:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-02-11 15:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-02-11 15:40:24.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to victoria-fixes'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2021-02-15 03:51:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-10 13:52:56.000000000', 'message': 'Use kube_master_ip for monitoring when no floating ip is used

This patch aims to fix clusters that uses only private network
and monitoring_enabled.

It was observed that:

- no floating ip, so the kube_master_external_ip is null
- because of that, the value that gets sent to the shell
for KUBE_MASTERS_PRIVATE is actually [null]
- this happens when deploying prometheus-operator
( label monitoring_enable=true )

Those topics above results in a cluster taking around 30
minutes to be completed until monitoring gives up configuring
endpoints.

Change-Id: I0fb4b2604f38bd3a325f82b1364b78ff17792c65
(cherry picked from commit 34f65582eb3cb8fee91838e9f02e5310bd12ada0)
'}]
commit_message:
Use kube_master_ip for monitoring when no floating ip is used

This patch aims to fix clusters that uses only private network
and monitoring_enabled.

It was observed that:

- no floating ip, so the kube_master_external_ip is null
- because of that, the value that gets sent to the shell
for KUBE_MASTERS_PRIVATE is actually [null]
- this happens when deploying prometheus-operator
( label monitoring_enable=true )

Those topics above results in a cluster taking around 30
minutes to be completed until monitoring gives up configuring
endpoints.

Change-Id: I0fb4b2604f38bd3a325f82b1364b78ff17792c65
(cherry picked from commit 34f65582eb3cb8fee91838e9f02e5310bd12ada0)

commit_message:
Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: Idd8fde4c4330c5125ed33f85d12fa6a551165f96

commit_message:
s3-tests: Only try to copy outputs when there *are* outputs

That way we avoid POST_FAILUREs when the real problem was in run.

Change-Id: I9eb84d1c794d58f0af3b7d78d3bc4660c1823dc8
(cherry picked from commit 73aa48a823a2e602089c3e37d6b9ec4c9e19d35f)

commit_message:
only wait for plugtime events in pre-live-migration

This change modifies _get_neutron_events_for_live_migration
to filter the event to just the subset that will be sent
at plug-time.

Currently neuton has a bug where by the dhcp agent
send a network-vif-plugged event during live migration after
we update the port profile with "migrating-to:"
this cause a network-vif-plugged event to be sent for
configuration where vif_plugging in nova/os-vif is a noop.

when that is corrected the current logic in nova cause the migration
to time out as its waiting for an event that will never arrive.

This change filters the set of events we wait for to just the plug
time events.

This backport has squashed the follow up change
I37c712ba9a0ab88c44d10f80da3254ab6c463a68 to remove the unused
migration paramater orginally added by this patch to
_get_neutron_events_for_live_migration

Related-Bug: #1815989
Closes-Bug: #1901707
Change-Id: Id2d8d72d30075200d2b07b847c4e5568599b0d3b
(cherry picked from commit 8b33ac064456482158b23c2a2d52f819ebb4c60e)

commit_message:
Fix incomplete backport of e8b24805d6ad863d91ecd84d00333e14821a7368

The change 7301812c9e32cde7ee145a1cbd18e8e76f52be37 was supposed to
be a backport of e8b24805d6ad863d91ecd84d00333e14821a7368 but in fact
it was incomplete and didn't have required changes in
the nova::metadata class.

This change implements the missing part to backport the change
completely.

Change-Id: I1dd3e696528ef2251822255d9ba9df76337b0a3b

commit_message:
Stop running Rocky jobs in check

We already run the rocky jobs in periodic. With Rocky in EOL, we
can remove them from being checked on every change.

Change-Id: I8728297c9b0742cd10977185568c75fc2b8b7e7e

commit_message:
Do not use tempestconf for ironic role tests

This seems to fail [1] for self signed certificates, and the minimal tests
pass without using it.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/802080/

Change-Id: I6003a1004b6042a804ea142684b42b17f16d6da8
(cherry picked from commit 07ac19dd27649af044bcc25e84ed346cf55efbff)

commit_message:
Move brick calls from cinder.utils to volume_utils

Move code that calls out to os-brick for connectors,
encryptors, etc., into volume_utils.

This leaves cinder/utils.py more general-purpose
cinder-wide code, which reduces unnecessary binding
between things like "cinder-manage db" and calls
that load much more of cinder's code (and external
libraries like os-brick).

This also means that some drivers only need to
import volume_utils and not cinder.utils.

Partial-Bug: #1912278
Change-Id: Ib2e2960ca354a47d303e0633c7d84e6da4b55b82

subject: Set unix socket auth method as none

We are gonna use libvirt unix socket in nova.
We are trying to realize live migration in libvirt while guarantee
secure. To realize this, replaced 127.0.0.1 with 0.0.0.0 for listen
address and plus enabled tls instead bare tcp.
And in the nova, used libvirt unix socket to connect instead of tcp
127.0.0.1 connection.
fyi, https://review.opendev.org/752108/
and https://review.opendev.org/752125/

commit_message:
Set unix socket auth method as none

We are gonna use libvirt unix socket in nova.
We are trying to realize live migration in libvirt while guarantee
secure. To realize this, replaced 127.0.0.1 with 0.0.0.0 for listen
address and plus enabled tls instead bare tcp.
And in the nova, used libvirt unix socket to connect instead of tcp
127.0.0.1 connection.
fyi, https://review.opendev.org/752108/
and https://review.opendev.org/752125/

Change-Id: Idb7d3a0d90be84d96b541c41fb90abdd33b7de94

commit_message:
Bump pip to latest in kubeadm Dockerfile

The cryptography package from pypi recently introduced some
breaking changes[0] with regards to forcing a dependency on rust.
This caused the multinode gate to fail when building the
kubeadm-aio image.

This change updates pip to the latest version as a workaround.

[0] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/5771

Change-Id: I337036d0ee425dcde917d88c4e48ac5a8b98018e

[{'created': '2021-01-12 11:57:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix: listing volumes with filters

This patch includes 2 fix for the following issues:

1) ast.literal_eval() doesn't work with int and float values
See comment inline

2) Do not traverse and modify the same dict:
while traversing filters dict, we're modifying it inside the loop
which distorts the order of elements (adding modified elements in the
end). to fix this, i've used a temp dict that will be used to traverse
and modification will be done in the filters dict.

Closes-Bug: #1883490

Change-Id: I18b4b0b1b71904b766f7b89df49f5539e3c7662a
(cherry picked from commit aed94a76cf62fdaedff793c7a9d998920b56c072)
(cherry picked from commit f94fc87e4d659ef1f59802d05b4f87a5a8c1bab2)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix: listing volumes with filters

This patch includes 2 fix for the following issues:

1) ast.literal_eval() doesn't work with int and float values
See comment inline

2) Do not traverse and modify the same dict:
while traversing filters dict, we're modifying it inside the loop
which distorts the order of elements (adding modified elements in the
end). to fix this, i've used a temp dict that will be used to traverse
and modification will be done in the filters dict.

Closes-Bug: #1883490

Change-Id: I18b4b0b1b71904b766f7b89df49f5539e3c7662a
(cherry picked from commit aed94a76cf62fdaedff793c7a9d998920b56c072)
(cherry picked from commit f94fc87e4d659ef1f59802d05b4f87a5a8c1bab2)

With changing the SOAP library backing oslo.vmware [1], the cookiejar of
a session must be accessed differently. Therefore, oslo.vmware
introduced a property on the client to abstract this change away. This
commit uses the new place to access the attribute.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/victoria/oslo-vmware-soap-library-switch.html

Change-Id: I3c769d3499f906b33725171a57313c8ae35b6a1d
'}]
commit_message:
vmware: Use cookiejar from oslo.vmware client directly

With changing the SOAP library backing oslo.vmware [1], the cookiejar of
a session must be accessed differently. Therefore, oslo.vmware
introduced a property on the client to abstract this change away. This
commit uses the new place to access the attribute.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/victoria/oslo-vmware-soap-library-switch.html

Change-Id: I3c769d3499f906b33725171a57313c8ae35b6a1d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-17 06:37:18.000000000', 'message': '[SVF]:Fix clone fcmap not being deleted in cleanup

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] check_vdisk_fc_mappings is not deleting
clone fc maps, if the flashcopy status is in copying autodelete is set
to on and copy progress is 100%. when multiple clones and snapshots
are created using common source volume, deleting the source volume
is not removing all the fcmaps involved in mapping with source volume.

This patch fixes the issue by removing the clone fcmap and then
removing the snapshot fcmap when the source has more than one fcmap.

Closes-Bug: #1890254

Change-Id: I84629cde6d27d6889a30d7c13d99f57c660adde7
(cherry picked from commit 3570a79a16127fd42216aa40b4f492e40533f0ed)
'}]
commit_message:
[SVF]:Fix clone fcmap not being deleted in cleanup

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] check_vdisk_fc_mappings is not deleting
clone fc maps, if the flashcopy status is in copying autodelete is set
to on and copy progress is 100%. when multiple clones and snapshots
are created using common source volume, deleting the source volume
is not removing all the fcmaps involved in mapping with source volume.

This patch fixes the issue by removing the clone fcmap and then
removing the snapshot fcmap when the source has more than one fcmap.

Closes-Bug: #1890254

Change-Id: I84629cde6d27d6889a30d7c13d99f57c660adde7
(cherry picked from commit 3570a79a16127fd42216aa40b4f492e40533f0ed)

[{'created': '2021-02-11 05:49:11.000000000', 'message': "Add ContainerDefaultPidsLimit to set default pid limits in containers.conf

Starting With podman 2.X the default pids-limits has been halved from
4096 to 2048 (see the dep-on change Id5d5fb9d20c0295763c78171190b9eda13508617 for
more details).

Let's add a parameter to override this value so an operator can raise
this limit globally.

Depends-On: Id5d5fb9d20c0295763c78171190b9eda13508617
Change-Id: I38a72609e6495b979861105f321b5730669a6a2b
(cherry picked from commit 781beb757121c3b3e535af6d2240163e58a33ddd)
"}]
commit_message:
Add ContainerDefaultPidsLimit to set default pid limits in containers.conf

Starting With podman 2.X the default pids-limits has been halved from
4096 to 2048 (see the dep-on change Id5d5fb9d20c0295763c78171190b9eda13508617 for
more details).

Let's add a parameter to override this value so an operator can raise
this limit globally.

Depends-On: Id5d5fb9d20c0295763c78171190b9eda13508617
Change-Id: I38a72609e6495b979861105f321b5730669a6a2b
(cherry picked from commit 781beb757121c3b3e535af6d2240163e58a33ddd)

commit_message:
Removing the upgrade code from Kuryr-Kubernetes repo

When moving from annotation to CRD a compatibility code was added
to allow user to upgrade from ussuri to victoria version. Now we are going
to upgrade to wallaby, so everyone should already use CRD and we
can remove the code.

Change-Id: I2acea7f6b3e1f02edd89f2f08127065a6556d367

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-21 08:14:01.000000000', 'message': 'CI: switch the multinode job to tempest-multinode-full-base

The non-base job is designed for the integrated gate and may have
unnecessary side effects. It has recently overriding the OVS agent
bridge settings, breaking our job.

Make the job voting again.

Also Remove lower-constraints job

As discussed during the upstream ironic community meeting on
Monday Dec 14 2020, the lower-constraints job is being removed.

Plus Cap version of ipa-builder to 2.2.0

Versions higher than 2.2.0 of ironic-python-agent-builder use
tinycore 11.x to build tinyipa, and that uses a kernel too recent
to be built on bionic.

Change-Id: Ied8cafd32c3e634d498467ebe878a411f0b24e6d
(cherry picked from commit 97ceb38a725cac797f9acf2c643d76c36e7293e0)

commit_message:
CI: switch the multinode job to tempest-multinode-full-base

The non-base job is designed for the integrated gate and may have
unnecessary side effects. It has recently overriding the OVS agent
bridge settings, breaking our job.

Make the job voting again.

Also Remove lower-constraints job

As discussed during the upstream ironic community meeting on
Monday Dec 14 2020, the lower-constraints job is being removed.

Plus Cap version of ipa-builder to 2.2.0

Versions higher than 2.2.0 of ironic-python-agent-builder use
tinycore 11.x to build tinyipa, and that uses a kernel too recent
to be built on bionic.

Change-Id: Ied8cafd32c3e634d498467ebe878a411f0b24e6d
(cherry picked from commit 97ceb38a725cac797f9acf2c643d76c36e7293e0)
(cherry picked from commit 840488e5951a360bb0f61ce36d33b5253ed19655)
(cherry picked from commit 85a1e3d23aa72c20364f7b684e5029c7af219745)

Add tls to Postgresql

This PS provides the capability to enable tls for the
Postgresql chart.

commit_message:
Add hosts integrated tests

We add hosts SCENARIO to run functional tests against roles that
runs with setup-hosts.yml play. As for now we've added test coverage for
openstack_hosts role.

We're also adding infra upgrade jobs.

Change-Id: Iefb94b31da3d84b8e48681aa4ca30322aa2b3993
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/+/774688

Thanks for this (and sorry for the extra email, I wasn't sure if we were still looking at it or if it was in the forgotten bin ;)
Two questions from my side:
1) This mechanism adds a level of protection, but what about compute nodes that are in the same rack of the controller. The hop in that case is 0 or 1. Those (By those I mean a malicious VMs that runs on a compute node) would still be able to talk to the bgp port of the controller in the same rack and do bad stuff? Or not really?
2) I think we can merge this with the main review? Or do you prefer to keep this separate?"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-01-13 11:40:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-01-13 15:18:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> 1) This mechanism adds a level of protection, but what about compute nodes that are in the same rack of the controller. The hop in that case is 0 or 1. Those (By those I mean a malicious VMs that runs on a compute node) would still be able to talk to the bgp port of the controller in the same rack and do bad stuff? Or not really?

Good point. I think packets from malicious VMs would not pose a security risk because they have to pass through a L3 router towards the BGP router and the L3 router decrements the TTL by one.

Workflow-1 for additional testing and discussion.

> 2) I think we can merge this with the main review? Or do you prefer to keep this separate?

I had a slight preference to keep this separate as the depends-on patch was on the verge of being approved (it was meanwhile) and this proposed approach may need more discussion so I didn't want to block the depends-on patch from merging."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-01-13 15:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-01-19 16:48:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FRR supports enforcing Generalized TTL Security Mechanism (GTSM) where
only neighbors that are the specified number of hops away will be
allowed to become neighbors.

This patch adds a new option to set the number of hops allowed,
defaulting to 1 for strict security out of the box. Setting value to
zero or less will disable GTSM.

commit_message:
tripleo_frr: add BGP TTL security

FRR supports enforcing Generalized TTL Security Mechanism (GTSM) where
only neighbors that are the specified number of hops away will be
allowed to become neighbors.

This patch adds a new option to set the number of hops allowed,
defaulting to 1 for strict security out of the box. Setting value to
zero or less will disable GTSM.

Change-Id: I1166f22fef8e3f6b825343b4e2792ce9cfb10547

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-06 16:59:30.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: Retry delete if VolumeIsBusy in _copy_image_to_volume

Cinder can fail to create an image-based volume if RBD mirroring
is enabled. With the journaling-based approach to RBD mirroring,
ceph will still create a snapshot as a result of volume creation.
The volume create in _create_from_image_download() results in
a snapshot getting created, resulting in a race where delete_volume()
gets a VolumeIsBusy exception.

Change-Id: Ib80e04512ec34a390e9e17af2f3544e18cad8598
Closes-Bug: #1900775
(cherry picked from commit 6231d26667508e34eb0a985f1f7ced1dbe623e1a)
'}, {'created': '2021-01-27 14:05:07.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: Retry delete if VolumeIsBusy in _copy_image_to_volume

commit_message:
RBD: Retry delete if VolumeIsBusy in _copy_image_to_volume

Cinder can fail to create an image-based volume if RBD mirroring
is enabled. With the journaling-based approach to RBD mirroring,
ceph will still create a snapshot as a result of volume creation.
The volume create in _create_from_image_download() results in
a snapshot getting created, resulting in a race where delete_volume()
gets a VolumeIsBusy exception.

Change-Id: Ib80e04512ec34a390e9e17af2f3544e18cad8598
Closes-Bug: #1900775
(cherry picked from commit 6231d26667508e34eb0a985f1f7ced1dbe623e1a)
(cherry picked from commit e1ed30838c3d72e70e3e06d5e7bc6f18d6bc4aad)
(cherry picked from commit 4f40f059f81ac27c92e4238f78ba649b69b09dd0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-03 17:25:30.000000000', 'message': 'Allow rhsm subscription test to be overrided in RHOSP deployment.

This allow the master playbook used for update to set
tripleo_redhat_enforce to false on a per role basis on Red Hat
environment.

The default in defaults/main.yml is now "true" so that it keeps its
behavior of being run by default if nothing is changed in the role
definition.

We then avoid running it on other plateform than Red Hat by adding an
explicit test in that tasks/main.yml file.

Overall the behavior is as follows:

  | Red Hat Env | tripleo_enforced     | Test run |
  |-------------+----------------------+----------|
  | True        | Unset                | Yes      |
  | True        | Set to true in role  | Yes      |
  | True        | Set to false in role | No       |
  | False       | Doesn't matter       | No       |

Change-Id: I6268a01d16f8288bf862003d19184fc93b88282a
Partial-Bug: #1912512
(cherry picked from commit 50f3e0ff3fbc757401b719fe7766e935bf5fc05f)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow rhsm subscription test to be overrided in RHOSP deployment.

This allow the master playbook used for update to set
tripleo_redhat_enforce to false on a per role basis on Red Hat
environment.

The default in defaults/main.yml is now "true" so that it keeps its
behavior of being run by default if nothing is changed in the role
definition.

We then avoid running it on other plateform than Red Hat by adding an
explicit test in that tasks/main.yml file.

Overall the behavior is as follows:

  | Red Hat Env | tripleo_enforced     | Test run |
  |-------------+----------------------+----------|
  | True        | Unset                | Yes      |
  | True        | Set to true in role  | Yes      |
  | True        | Set to false in role | No       |
  | False       | Doesn't matter       | No       |

Change-Id: I6268a01d16f8288bf862003d19184fc93b88282a
Partial-Bug: #1912512
(cherry picked from commit 50f3e0ff3fbc757401b719fe7766e935bf5fc05f)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifdd784e5b9f5de8a376108379b7b34b0197389c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-10 11:46:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix run-tempest black/exclude var setting

Before [1] we didn't have conditionals for tempest_black_regex
being set or not, therefore it had a default value of empty
string set in the role's defaults. However after [1] we do
have such conditionals which make setting the default value
unnecessary - especially when we're asking if the var is
defined - it will be always defined.
Therefore this patch removes the default setting of
tempest_black_regex and tempest_exclude_regex.

The patch also removes 'Set tempest_exclude_regex' task
introduced by [1] as it appears unnecessary as well. This
task simply copied tempest_black_regex value to
tempest_exclude_regex. However there are 2 tasks below which
do the same logic plus more - they build CLI arguments for
tempest where depending on which ansible var is used the
appropriate CLI arg is chosen - tempest_black_regex is set,
--black-regex will be passed to tempest (for backward
compatibility) and if tempest_exclude_regex is set,
--exclude-regex will passed to tempest.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/768583

Change-Id: I3e45741057e7a95b282b03bab4695f46c62d5271
"}, {'created': '2021-02-11 17:28:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix run-tempest black/exclude var setting

Before [1] we didn't have conditionals for tempest_black_regex
being set or not, therefore it had a default value of empty
string set in the role's defaults. However after [1] we do
have such conditionals which make setting the default value
unnecessary - especially when we're asking if the var is
defined - it will be always defined.
Therefore this patch removes the default setting of
tempest_black_regex and tempest_exclude_regex.

The patch also removes 'Set tempest_exclude_regex' task
introduced by [1] as it appears unnecessary as well. This
task simply copied tempest_black_regex value to
tempest_exclude_regex. However there are 2 tasks below which
do the same logic plus more - they build CLI arguments for
tempest where depending on which ansible var is used the
appropriate CLI arg is chosen - tempest_black_regex is set,
--black-regex will be passed to tempest (for backward
compatibility) and if tempest_exclude_regex is set,
--exclude-regex will passed to tempest.

The patch creates a new temporary ansible var which will be used
only internally. The role will store in it the CLI argument
chosen dynamically which is passed to tempest later. Before we
reused the tempest_exclude_regex variable for that, however that
causes problems whent the var is set on a role level as set_fact
won't override such var.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/768583

Change-Id: I3e45741057e7a95b282b03bab4695f46c62d5271
"}]
commit_message:
Fix run-tempest black/exclude var setting

Before [1] we didn't have conditionals for tempest_black_regex
being set or not, therefore it had a default value of empty
string set in the role's defaults. However after [1] we do
have such conditionals which make setting the default value
unnecessary - especially when we're asking if the var is
defined - it will be always defined.
Therefore this patch removes the default setting of
tempest_black_regex and tempest_exclude_regex.

The patch also removes 'Set tempest_exclude_regex' task
introduced by [1] as it appears unnecessary as well. This
task simply copied tempest_black_regex value to
tempest_exclude_regex. However there are 2 tasks below which
do the same logic plus more - they build CLI arguments for
tempest where depending on which ansible var is used the
appropriate CLI arg is chosen - tempest_black_regex is set,
--black-regex will be passed to tempest (for backward
compatibility) and if tempest_exclude_regex is set,
--exclude-regex will passed to tempest.

The patch creates a new temporary ansible var which will be used
only internally. The role will store in it the CLI argument
chosen dynamically which is passed to tempest later. Before we
reused the tempest_exclude_regex variable for that, however that
causes problems whent the var is set on a role level as set_fact
won't override such var.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/768583

Change-Id: I3e45741057e7a95b282b03bab4695f46c62d5271

commit_message:
Track release note changes on chart change

This change adds in the script to eventually enforce release note
updates when a chart version is bumped. It will currently be set
to ignore if it fails, however once all of the charts are updated,
this should be removed to hard-enforce.

Change-Id: If3b3b26619f7288b723c0d4e6e1b97d6cfe1cf74

commit_message:
Updates testenv to py38 and removes RIZON_INTEGRATION_TESTS_CONFIG_FILE

Updates testenv to py38, as I think most developers
have python 3.8 installed on their environment.
And RIZON_INTEGRATION_TESTS_CONFIG_FILE variable is
also removed. According to codesearch it is not used
anywhere.

Change-Id: Id04ee718e9b1026f00c6d5db9d4db3914e23ba5f

Validated that the schema at the base of this tree's parent matches this one for mysql. I guess mysqldump can't generate stable output, so it shows a bunch of things moved around in the schema, but they're just reordered. Not different. Postgres dump is actually identical. Sqlite is in like insert order or something so I'm not even bothering, but it doesn't matter anyway.

FWIW, I don't think we should throw away generate-schemas -- just put it somewhere so we can do this fun game again next time. Even if it's not run-nable directly in a few years, it's readable as a pattern."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2021-01-16 09:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 32761, 'date': '2021-01-19 12:04:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-10 15:26:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-10 18:09:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
db: Compact Train database migrations

Compact Train database migrations into a single migration,
'402_train.py'.

Users will now need to update to Train before updating to Ussuri or
later.

Specific changes include:

- Add 'cross_cell_move' column to 'migrations' table (397)
- Add 'vpmems' column to 'instance_extra' table (398)
- Add 'hidden' column to 'instances' table (399)
- Add 'user_id' and 'project_id' columns to 'migrations' table (401)
- Add 'resources' column to 'instance_extra' table (402)

As there are boolean tables here, we're once again hitting the issue
whereby we need to explicitly disable contraints for boolean fields to
keep the schemas the same.

When testing, the previous base version was 391. It is now 402.

Change-Id: Iecb531728a83194117e0e7e5f4b6189073541f68
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

> 
> About the CI:
> - Looks like the Kioxia CI hasn't responded since patch set 15
> - you should remove ENABLE_DEBUG_LOG_LEVEL=False from devstack/local.conf (or set it to True)
> 
> Some stylistic comments inline.

About the CI, I see it has been running and responding fine to every patch that gets a Zuul approval.

Examples of last responses:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/771081/3#message-88a62f52f3504b8f3010e606997158060fbf5240
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/764264/2#message-0e4a27ce24039d153e7eb97781d292d45ad0b333

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/765818/2#message-522a20779bb02ea2ae8213e087333c0ed3948c7f

If you look at the date-sorted list of patch ref responses: http://104.254.65.37/?C=M;O=D - you can see there are multiple responses since Feb 1 until now

I changed the ENABLE_DEBUG_LOG_LEVEL and did a test run (previously we saw better performance with debug turned off that is why we had it this way) - from now on CI log artifacts will have debug logs enabled. commit_message:
Add KIOXIA KumoScale NVMeOF driver

* Supported Protocol
 - NVMeOF

* Supported Feature
 - Volume Create/Delete
 - Volume Attach/Detach
 - Snapshot Create/Delete
 - Create Volume from Snapshot
 - Get Volume Stats
 - Copy Image to Volume
 - Copy Volume to Image
 - Clone Volume
 - Extend Volume

ThirdPartySystems: KIOXIA CI
Implements: blueprint kumoscale-driver
Change-Id: Ibaae35b02ccc254a8a0202ec1635f62ab18486ea

commit_message:
Check that etc/resolv.conf.ORIG exists before edit

In RHEL 8.4, /etc/resolv.conf is not present by default.
As such, removing the nameservers will fail because
etc/resolv.conf.ORIG never gets created.

This patch makes the nameserver edit only if the
etc/resolv.conf.ORIG file exists.

Change-Id: I2178996d899ffe43e11bfeb512e4fcaa941b8410

subject: Move upload to dockerhub to run from post-run
messages: [{'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2021-02-03 22:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18256, 'date': '2021-02-03 22:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18250, 'date': '2021-02-03 22:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2021-02-12 20:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-03 22:02:37.000000000', 'message': "Move upload to dockerhub to run from post-run

Previous logic paused job after run playbook prior to uploading image
to dockerhub to run test deployment. That resulted in multiple paused
job and deadlocking if scheduled in cloud with not sufficient resources.
Since we don't pause jobs anymore, there's no much sense in running
upload playbook in post-run that is run even if run playbook failed.

Change-Id: Ic492aaa02b29db226b4cfc32fb50d231aab6fdfe
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Move upload to dockerhub to run from post-run

Previous logic paused job after run playbook prior to uploading image
to dockerhub to run test deployment. That resulted in multiple paused
job and deadlocking if scheduled in cloud with not sufficient resources.
Since we don't pause jobs anymore, there's no much sense in running
upload playbook in post-run that is run even if run playbook failed.

Change-Id: Ic492aaa02b29db226b4cfc32fb50d231aab6fdfe
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

commit_message:
tox miniversion update to 3.1.1

In 3.1.1, tox had fixed:

mishandling the basepython directive [1]
ignoring PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE [2]
More details in [3]

[1] tox-dev/tox#477
[2] tox-dev/tox@336f4f6
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/thread.html#132075

Change-Id: I41dd046fa9edc804db32e718794bdbeda1c568bd

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

Also removing lower constraints and related tox environment as they are
no longer needed.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

NOTE(hberaud): This backport also includes change
Iefa00bee6f67e9e82f0c703a7aff144c0dcbe1ec squashed  to avoid to
backport multiple patches

Change-Id: Icf48ef72fbfff88dda2714b386dbbfe355dc1acb
(cherry picked from commit 686a8b61826d9bed0a989e645a13c708c3e6343c)

"}]
commit_message:
[TRAIN-Only] Warn about docker if python3

We don't want docker to be used if running under python3, so let's throw
a warning. Since train will support centos7 still, we need to not have
this be a default.

commit_message:
Stop octavia servics in unupgraded controllers

This change makes octavia services on unupgrade controller nodes get
stopped, because all services in the unupgrade controllers should be
stopped before we start the upgraded controller[1].

[1] 8529ce60da84d2aa1e1c9e6994303678261b09da

Change-Id: I51855841c269ec593933288af4135f5d06a139fe

[{'created': '2020-11-23 09:38:14.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp SolidFire: Fix clone and request timeout issues

Users are experiencing timeout issues in certain environments, mostly
when volumes are too big (ie. multi-terabyte volumes), due to poor
network performance or upgrade issues that revolve around the SolidFire
cluster. A viable solution is to make driver timeout values
configurable in cinder.conf, so users can set these timeouts
according to their needs.

This patch adds two timeout settings to the SolidFire driver
(for cloning operation and globally to all api requests), to
allow users to set the appropriate timeouts for their environment.

Closes-Bug: #1898587
Change-Id: Ie330c76a5db0ea76d4fed5a6ae7b8736dadc8591
(cherry picked from commit c607a82a992ebe63b4ae005746f2b9e8104bb3a0)

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix clone and request timeout issues

Users are experiencing timeout issues in certain environments, mostly
when volumes are too big (ie. multi-terabyte volumes), due to poor
network performance or upgrade issues that revolve around the SolidFire
cluster. A viable solution is to make driver timeout values
configurable in cinder.conf, so users can set these timeouts
according to their needs.

This patch adds two timeout settings to the SolidFire driver
(for cloning operation and globally to all api requests), to
allow users to set the appropriate timeouts for their environment.

Closes-Bug: #1898587
Change-Id: Ie330c76a5db0ea76d4fed5a6ae7b8736dadc8591
(cherry picked from commit c607a82a992ebe63b4ae005746f2b9e8104bb3a0)
(cherry picked from commit 3b2e7d662b6cca54d13d46161560a497d4ec5bd0)

[{'created': '2020-11-26 02:07:51.000000000', 'message': "NetApp SolidFire: Fix error on cluster workload rebalancing

When SolidFire is under heavy load or being upgraded, the
SolidFire cluster may automatically move connections from primary
to secondary nodes, in order to rebalance cluster workload.

Although this operation ocurrs very quickly, if an operation is made
to a volume at the same time it's being moved, there might be a
chance that API calls such as create snapshot could fail with
xNotPrimary error. Normally this will succeed on a retry of the
operation.

This patch fixes this issue by adding the xNotPrimary exception to
our list of retryable exceptions in the SolidFire driver.

Change-Id: I67dd2bfba37adcb7cda5f1cd08ff641410ec3f6b
Closes-Bug: #1891914
(cherry picked from commit 8d0c08b4bb9d32f2c02dcc60f1f482331197e546)
"}, {'created': '2021-02-04 19:16:05.000000000', 'message': "NetApp SolidFire: Fix error on cluster workload rebalancing

SolidFire cluster may automatically move connections from primary

Although this operation ocurrs very quickly, if an operation is made

chance that API calls such as create snapshot could fail with
xNotPrimary error. Normally this will succeed on a retry of the
operation.

This patch fixes this issue by adding the xNotPrimary exception to
our list of retryable exceptions in the SolidFire driver.

Change-Id: I67dd2bfba37adcb7cda5f1cd08ff641410ec3f6b
Closes-Bug: #1891914
(cherry picked from commit 8d0c08b4bb9d32f2c02dcc60f1f482331197e546)

"}]
commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix error on cluster workload rebalancing

When SolidFire is under heavy load or being upgraded, the
SolidFire cluster may automatically move connections from primary
to secondary nodes, in order to rebalance cluster workload.

Although this operation ocurrs very quickly, if an operation is made
to a volume at the same time it's being moved, there might be a
chance that API calls such as create snapshot could fail with
xNotPrimary error. Normally this will succeed on a retry of the
operation.

This patch fixes this issue by adding the xNotPrimary exception to
our list of retryable exceptions in the SolidFire driver.

Change-Id: I67dd2bfba37adcb7cda5f1cd08ff641410ec3f6b
Closes-Bug: #1891914
(cherry picked from commit 8d0c08b4bb9d32f2c02dcc60f1f482331197e546)
(cherry picked from commit 622244a755b75a52d079f92d8526f6eb5b517106)

commit_message:
Introduce mitmproxy & prometheus-webhook-snmp

- Add http API proxy to be used by alertmanager
- Add prometheus-webhook-snmp webhook with 2 destinations setup
- Add mitmproxy as part of Alertmanager
- Remove snmpnotifer webhook

Change-Id: Id63b25702e50258694c66b34fb8eae093b52d5c6

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
> 
> Wonder if we could replace all these with a jq call now instead of inline python

Without testing thoroughly, this works:

    # cat node_lookup.txt 
    {
    '09e1660c-caf5-44a4-b0d4-a65af62cfc16': {'nova::compute::cpu_dedicated_set': ['1-4']},
    '19e1660c-caf5-44a4-b0d4-a65af62cfc16': {'hello': 'world', 'nova::compute::cpu_dedicated_set': ['2-2']}
    }
    # cat node_lookup.txt | sed "s/'/\"/g" | jq -r $'keys[] as $k | "echo \'\(.[$k])\' | tee \($k).json > \($k | ascii_upcase).json;"'
    echo '{"nova::compute::cpu_dedicated_set":["1-4"]}' | tee 09e1660c-caf5-44a4-b0d4-a65af62cfc16.json > 09E1660C-CAF5-44A4-B0D4-A65AF62CFC16.json;
    echo '{"hello":"world","nova::compute::cpu_dedicated_set":["2-2"]}' | tee 19e1660c-caf5-44a4-b0d4-a65af62cfc16.json > 19E1660C-CAF5-44A4-B0D4-A65AF62CFC16.json;
    # eval $(cat node_lookup.txt | sed "s/'/\"/g" | jq -r $'keys[] as $k | "echo \'\(.[$k])\' | tee \($k).json > \($k | ascii_upcase).json;"')
    # ls -l *9*1660*
    -rw-r--r--. 1 root root 45 Feb  9 02:24 09e1660c-caf5-44a4-b0d4-a65af62cfc16.json
    -rw-r--r--. 1 root root 45 Feb  9 02:24 09E1660C-CAF5-44A4-B0D4-A65AF62CFC16.json
    -rw-r--r--. 1 root root 61 Feb  9 02:24 19e1660c-caf5-44a4-b0d4-a65af62cfc16.json
    -rw-r--r--. 1 root root 61 Feb  9 02:24 19E1660C-CAF5-44A4-B0D4-A65AF62CFC16.json
    # cat 19e1660c-caf5-44a4-b0d4-a65af62cfc16.json 
    {"hello":"world","nova::compute::cpu_dedicated_set":["2-2"]}

But imho, it's a bit more cryptic than the python, and my jq skills might be limited here, maybe there's a better way to do this. The limitations I see is that jq can't write to a file by itself, and I didn't find how to parse single quoted json because it doesn't respect json standards from my research.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-02-09 02:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> But imho, it's a bit more cryptic than the python, and my jq skills might be limited here, maybe there's a better way to do this. The limitations I see is that jq can't write to a file by itself, and I didn't find how to parse single quoted json because it doesn't respect json standards from my research.

Oh and eval would be a security risk here.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-02-09 11:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-02-10 10:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is how I tested it http://paste.openstack.org/show/KcPaFouzITVTEftPsYfD/'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-02-11 09:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-02-11 09:06:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Nice catch, I like the idea. There must be reason why it worked before, so I made ast the fallbacked method.

Regarding your comment on pastebin about jq being able to parse this, I was never able to get jq to read single-quoted json strings:

commit_message:
Add WEBROOT to ngdetails navigation

Default index URL for angular details page doesn't consider WEBROOT
while building navigations. That is why refreshing details page or
opening it in a new tab works perfectly when WEBROOT is "/" and fails
for apache deployment where WEBROOT is "/dashboard/".

This patch adds WEBROOT to index URL and builds a proper navigation.

Closes-Bug: #1902821

Change-Id: Id609e5499cc8f53dbae36febc945568e45d291f3
(cherry picked from commit f7442851c4b85a6a091635f0930c07dbd43cf8fb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-02 16:30:29.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Always enable USB controller on PPC64

In change I5b16d9ddc9cad56b367d1ad94abba95d675840b0, we started
disabling the USB controller whenever we deemed it unnecessary. We did
this by scanning through the requested devices and identifying those
that used the USB bus, only adding the controller if one or more
matching devices were found.

It transpires that just as QEMU adds PS2 input devices for x86, libvirt
automatically adds USB input devices for PPC64 [1]. These devices won't
appear in the XML we provide to libvirt, since we, the user, are not the
ones requesting them, but the disabling of the instance will result in
the instance failing to boot and libvirt emitting the following error
message:

  unsupported configuration: USB is disabled for this domain, but USB
  devices are present in the domain XML

Resolve this issue by bypassing the devices check and leaving
configuration of the USB controller to libvirt, as before.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/blob/3d42a5766/src/qemu/qemu_domain.c#L3559-L3560

Change-Id: Iefcb4bbe1ae31dcf79a3ba88372b4971d97ad2ea
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1914259
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Always enable USB controller on PPC64

In change I5b16d9ddc9cad56b367d1ad94abba95d675840b0, we started
disabling the USB controller whenever we deemed it unnecessary. We did
this by scanning through the requested devices and identifying those
that used the USB bus, only adding the controller if one or more
matching devices were found.

It transpires that just as QEMU adds PS2 input devices for x86, libvirt
automatically adds USB input devices for PPC64 [1]. These devices won't
appear in the XML we provide to libvirt, since we, the user, are not the
ones requesting them, but the disabling of the instance will result in
the instance failing to boot and libvirt emitting the following error
message:

  unsupported configuration: USB is disabled for this domain, but USB
  devices are present in the domain XML

Resolve this issue by bypassing the devices check and leaving
configuration of the USB controller to libvirt, as before.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/blob/3d42a5766/src/qemu/qemu_domain.c#L3559-L3560

Change-Id: Iefcb4bbe1ae31dcf79a3ba88372b4971d97ad2ea
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1914259

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-09 23:24:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix number of ports requested on pool pre-population

In order to reduce the load when requesting a number of ports
fpr the pre-population the number of ports to be requested
is divided by 2. However, that division can result in a
float number which does not allow the pre-population to finalize.
This commit fixes the issue by retriving the integer part of the
division.

Closes-bug: 1915214
Change-Id: I72d5f4e606d51b2e24703031c3d7fecaa0153c23
'}]
commit_message:
Fix number of ports requested on pool pre-population

In order to reduce the load when requesting a number of ports
fpr the pre-population the number of ports to be requested
is divided by 2. However, that division can result in a
float number which does not allow the pre-population to finalize.
This commit fixes the issue by retriving the integer part of the
division.

Closes-bug: 1915214
Change-Id: I72d5f4e606d51b2e24703031c3d7fecaa0153c23

commit_message:
Introduce common personas for secure RBAC

This commit lays down some common personas we're trying to introduce
across OpenStack services. Later commits will use these personas in
ironic's existing policies.

This will help use improve the security posture of OpenStack as a whole
and provide a more consistent experience operators and end users.

From what I see, with this patch the conductor will start to loop when there is not enough available memory and wait until the pressure goes down. Since the kernel in general is designed to make use of all memory on the system, e.g. by filling the page cache or the write buffers, wouldn't we end up in a situation where the conductor would loop forever (since there is nothing which actively frees up memory again)?"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-07-07 13:17:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> From what I see, with this patch the conductor will start to loop
 > when there is not enough available memory and wait until the
 > pressure goes down. Since the kernel in general is designed to make
 > use of all memory on the system, e.g. by filling the page cache or
 > the write buffers, wouldn't we end up in a situation where the
 > conductor would loop forever (since there is nothing which actively
 > frees up memory again)?

For a maximum of 90 seconds on a direct image conversion and would just punt an iscsi deploy until it times out.

The memory_available counter is also free memory in the terms of what is used but not counting buffer or the page cache, at least that is how I understand it. The idea, at least as I had it, is if the available system memory becomes free again, we can resume operations again."}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-07-07 14:19:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(8 comments)

I think you are right, 'available' seems the correct metric.

If I am not mistaken there might be a unit issue, though."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-07-08 13:42:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-07-08 13:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

'}, {'created': '2020-06-02 21:52:35.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Guard conductor from consuming all of the ram

Change-Id: I69db0169c564c5b22abd0cb1b890f409c13b0ac2
'}, {'created': '2020-06-15 21:59:11.000000000', 'message': 'Guard conductor from consuming all of the ram

Adds a guard in the conductor to prevent multiple parallel
deployment operations from running the conductor out of memory.

Change-Id: I69db0169c564c5b22abd0cb1b890f409c13b0ac2
'}, {'created': '2020-07-02 18:18:25.000000000', 'message': 'Guard conductor from consuming all of the ram

Adds a guard in the conductor to prevent multiple parallel
deployment operations from running the conductor out of memory.

Change-Id: I69db0169c564c5b22abd0cb1b890f409c13b0ac2
'}, {'created': '2020-07-06 23:51:51.000000000', 'message': "Guard conductor from consuming all of the ram

One of the biggest frustrations larger operators have is when they
trigger a massive number of concurrent deployments. As one would
expect, the memory utilization of the conductor goes up. Except,
even with the default number of worker threads, if we're requested
to convert 80 images at the same time, or to perform the write-out
to the remote node at the same time, we will consume a large amount
of system RAM. Or more specifically, qemu-img will consume a large
amount of memory.

If the amount of memory goes too low, the system can trigger
OOMKiller which will slay processes using ram. Ideally, we do not
want this to happen to our conductor process, much less the work
that is being performed, so we need to add some guard rails to help
keep us from entering into situations where we may compromise the
conductor by taking on too much work.

Adds a guard in the conductor to prevent multiple parallel
deployment operations from running the conductor out of memory.

With the defaults, the conductor will attempt to throttle back
automatically and hold worker threads which will slow down the
amount of work also proceeding through the conductor, as we are
in a memory condition where we should be careful about the work.

The defaults allow this to occur for a total of 15 seconds between
re-check of available RAM, for a total number of six retries.
The minimum default is 1024 (MB), as this is the amount of memory
qemu-img allocates when trying to write images. This quite literally
means no additional qemu-img process can spawn until the default
memory situation has resolved itself.

Change-Id: I69db0169c564c5b22abd0cb1b890f409c13b0ac2

of system RAM. Or more specifically, qemu-img will consume a large
amount of memory.

If the amount of memory goes too low, the system can trigger
OOMKiller which will slay processes using ram. Ideally, we do not
want this to happen to our conductor process, much less the work
that is being performed, so we need to add some guard rails to help
keep us from entering into situations where we may compromise the
conductor by taking on too much work.

Adds a guard in the conductor to prevent multiple parallel
deployment operations from running the conductor out of memory.

With the defaults, the conductor will attempt to throttle back
automatically and hold worker threads which will slow down the
amount of work also proceeding through the conductor, as we are
in a memory condition where we should be careful about the work.

The defaults allow this to occur for a total of 15 seconds between
re-check of available RAM, for a total number of six retries.
The minimum default is 1024 (MB), as this is the amount of memory
qemu-img allocates when trying to write images. This quite literally
means no additional qemu-img process can spawn until the default
memory situation has resolved itself.

Change-Id: I69db0169c564c5b22abd0cb1b890f409c13b0ac2

commit_message:
Guard conductor from consuming all of the ram

One of the biggest frustrations larger operators have is when they
trigger a massive number of concurrent deployments. As one would
expect, the memory utilization of the conductor goes up. Except,
even with the default number of worker threads, if we're requested
to convert 80 images at the same time, or to perform the write-out
to the remote node at the same time, we will consume a large amount
of system RAM. Or more specifically, qemu-img will consume a large
amount of memory.

If the amount of memory goes too low, the system can trigger
OOMKiller which will slay processes using ram. Ideally, we do not
want this to happen to our conductor process, much less the work
that is being performed, so we need to add some guard rails to help
keep us from entering into situations where we may compromise the
conductor by taking on too much work.

Adds a guard in the conductor to prevent multiple parallel
deployment operations from running the conductor out of memory.

With the defaults, the conductor will attempt to throttle back
automatically and hold worker threads which will slow down the
amount of work also proceeding through the conductor, as we are
in a memory condition where we should be careful about the work.

The defaults allow this to occur for a total of 15 seconds between
re-check of available RAM, for a total number of six retries.
The minimum default is 1024 (MB), as this is the amount of memory
qemu-img allocates when trying to write images. This quite literally
means no additional qemu-img process can spawn until the default
memory situation has resolved itself.

Change-Id: I69db0169c564c5b22abd0cb1b890f409c13b0ac2

messages:
[{'account_id': 32803, 'date': '2021-02-05 20:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2021-02-08 15:36:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks for this Garrett. It looks good to me. One thing is this will need a release note to describe the behavioral change (this won't land this release but next release). Also I'd like thedac or icey to review because there is code in actions/security_checklist.py has 'def enforce_password_check' so want to ensure we're all on the same page."}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-02-08 15:45:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Given that we're modifying the security bits, it would be great to see this test (https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/blob/master/zaza/openstack/charm_tests/openstack_dashboard/tests.py#L410-L419) expanded to more completely reflect what we expect to be passing and failing like we do here for nova: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/blob/35840a66d6788dc4899847747ee7523895f46e1b/zaza/openstack/charm_tests/nova/tests.py#L485-L529"}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2021-02-09 00:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add ENFORCE_PASSWORD_CHECK setting

This setting is a behavior change, requring the admin password
to be provided when changing the password of an admin user. Enabling
this setting by default adheres to the security recommendation
provided in the OpenStack security guide [0].

To enable this setting for Queens (the oldest supported OpenStack
release at the time of this commit), a new local_settings.py file was
copied from the Ocata template to ensure that any future versions will
inherit this setting until a new change is made.

Due to the security-checklist action currently failing [1], these have been
extracted to another class, and refactored in the zaza-openstack-tests
repo [2].

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/dashboard/checklist.html

[1] https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/blob/2ef404be7563ab9a4907376c3b33719fee41679f/zaza/openstack/charm_tests/openstack_dashboard/tests.py#L418

[2] https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/501

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/501
Closes-Bug: #1883196
Change-Id: Idfd8654732289481806aea8b47ffa28cf3f97697

commit_message:
Require oslo.serialization 4.1.0

Older versions cause the RBD driver to break
when using JSON logging.  (bug #1908607)

Change-Id: Iaeb29b70e176ae1c4dcdc9b37c26f267a95dda55

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-10 03:49:57.000000000', 'message': 'change ipv6 public network cidr on tempest-slow job

Neutron recently enhanced CIDR overlap checks for all the subnets
attached to router including external [1]. This breaks tempest
scenario ipv6 tests which is fixed in tempest by the following
commit [2]. However the fix mentioned in [2] cannot be ported
back to tempest 23.0.0 as rocky is in EM stage.

To fix this, the public IPv6 network CIDR is changed to use
different subnet on the tempest-slow job.

Closes-Bug: #1914037

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/Id5d8ac09a38c656619f88a6f87b8f384fe4c55a8
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/4ad346e6497d4fbad9e379e8ed50730a0b6b55a3

Change-Id: I62a746cc871434e8488b19bc2ef5bbcfcf4f0be6
'}, {'created': '2021-02-10 19:28:36.000000000', 'message': 'change ipv6 public network cidr on tempest-slow job

Neutron recently enhanced CIDR overlap checks for all the subnets
attached to router including external [1]. This breaks tempest
scenario ipv6 tests which is fixed in tempest by the following
commit [2]. However the fix mentioned in [2] cannot be ported
back to tempest 23.0.0 as rocky is in EM stage.

To fix this, the public IPv6 network CIDR is changed to use
different subnet on the tempest-slow job.

commit_message:
change ipv6 public network cidr on tempest-slow job

Neutron recently enhanced CIDR overlap checks for all the subnets
attached to router including external [1]. This breaks tempest
scenario ipv6 tests which is fixed in tempest by the following
commit [2]. However the fix mentioned in [2] cannot be ported
back to tempest 23.0.0 as rocky is in EM stage.

To fix this, the public IPv6 network CIDR is changed to use
different subnet on the tempest-slow job.

Closes-Bug: #1914037

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/Id5d8ac09a38c656619f88a6f87b8f384fe4c55a8
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/4ad346e6497d4fbad9e379e8ed50730a0b6b55a3

Change-Id: I62a746cc871434e8488b19bc2ef5bbcfcf4f0be6

commit_message:
[Validator Run] Add return code management

The validator run command will now raise a CommandError exception if one
or more validations have failed.

This patch is also aligning the result table to left in order to be
compliant with other table output.

Closes-Bug: #1915154

Change-Id: I265b77de4b8f9b611f6bc908e90d8f69a26439ab
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit be3f43ff81e24a0262d8f02495cca9a876731f7c)
(cherry picked from commit 5317f37ae3304ec37faaf812e0c319669a8a066b)
(cherry picked from commit 53e24c0b5749ca398eb7bf962031be4ad1dffcde)
